Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it’s not just what we do that matters–it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

[]

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Data Analyst – Global Education Group

📍 West London - 4 to 5 days in office

💸 £35,000




🌍About the Company

A world-leading group of premium private schools is looking for a Data Analyst to join its growing team. The organisation is expanding rapidly, aiming to reach 120 schools this year. Specialising in high-end, prestigious institutions, the group continues to grow through new school development and the acquisition of successful schools.




🔍 Role Overview

The Data Analyst will work within the Marketing department but collaborate across the business, supporting senior stakeholders such as CEOs, Heads of Schools, and Global Directors. This role is key in maintaining data accuracy, optimizing workflows, and delivering insights that drive strategic decision-making.




👤 Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Reporting: Extract, manipulate, and analyze data using SQL, develop dashboards, and create reports in Power BI.
Pipeline & Issue Management: Maintain and troubleshoot the Azure Data Warehouse, resolving data inconsistencies with the Engineering team.
Stakeholder & Cross-Team Support: Handle data requests from executives, collaborate with global teams, and provide insights across departments.
Process & Project Optimization: Improve workflows, maintain documentation, and assist in performance analysis, acquisitions, and forecasting.




🎯About You

To be a successful candidate in this process, you will require:

Strong SQL skills (Joins, tables, transactional SQL) as a must-have.
Any experience in reporting, analytics, and data visualization on top of SQL, will be beneficial.
Analytical mindset with a problem-solving approachability to investigate data issues independently.
Strong stakeholder communication skills and experience working cross-functionally.
Familiarity with corporate environments, particularly in management consulting or structured business settings.
Exposure to Jira or Trello for project management is preferred.




⚡Work Environment

Fast-paced, high-pressure setting – adaptability is key.
Small, hands-on team with high visibility and direct impact.
Ticketing and service desk approach to handling data-related issues.
Structured corporate environment requiring attention to detail and precision.




📝 Interview Process

Initial Interview – 30-minute discussion with the team (CV review).
Technical Assessment – SQL-based test followed by a discussion.
Final Round – In-person meeting.




🔔 Interested? Apply now and be part of a global team making an impact through data-driven insights! 🚀

Title: Senior Insight Analyst - Global
Description:
Company Description

We’re ASOS, the online retailer for fashion lovers all around the world.

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you’re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

As the Senior Analyst working in our Global Commerce & Channels function you will be responsible for surfacing insight relating to our market strategies and trading dynamics. The focus point for this role is understanding performance dynamics within our key markets across customers, products, marketing, as well as the onsite experience. Over time, you may move on to other priorities such as, width and depth optimisation, price point analysis, digital trading dynamics or customer behaviour trends.

The Details


Interrogate internal and external data to surface holistic insight relating to performance drivers at market level, drawing out opportunities and risks and resulting actions for the business
Measurement and analysis of our core trading KPIs such as visits, conversion, customers and our product offering and pricing
Provide an end-to-end understanding into why purchased items are returned, both at a customer and product level.
Deep understanding of our market intelligence toolset and utilising this data to gain understanding of how competitor and market dynamics impact our own performance
Work with senior leadership in function to develop market strategies balancing growth and profitability
Tell compelling, data led stories to highlight these opportunities and be comfortable presenting these to senior management
Act as a data champion within the function, working with the teams to upskill and educate on data and insight
Work closely with business stakeholders like the product and marketing teams to gain deep understanding of business processes and decisions which impact market and trade performance
Work closely with finance to ensure you understand how we measure and forecast market performance
Build and maintain a network across the wider data teams, especially insight analysts, the AI team and data services to drive knowledge and capability sharing
Supporting our culture by championing Diversity, Equity & Inclusion strategies.



Qualifications

About You


Experience working in an insight role focussing on market or retail insight, preferably within the e-commerce space
Strong SQL and Adobe skills, experience within advanced analytics
Strong story telling skills and a proven track record of shaping business decisions through insight
Highly numerate and strong attention to detail
Passion for problem solving
Proactive approach and enthusiasm for sharing ideas and driving them forward
Able to communicate information clearly and concisely
Good project management skills, able to handle multiple tasks and manage priorities as needed



Additional Information

BeneFITS’


Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
ASOS Develops (personal development opportunities across the business)
Employee sample sales
Access to a huge range of LinkedIn learning materials
25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private medical care scheme
Flexible benefits allowance - which you can choose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits



Why take our word for it? Search #InsideASOS on our socials to see what life at ASOS is like.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Drive Healf’s growth with data. Analyse trends, optimise insights, and build models that power decisions in a fast-scaling eCommerce startup. Join A+ players and do your life’s best work. 🚀




Build the future of Health. Create your life’s best work.

If healthcare were built for today, it wouldn’t resemble the reactive, fragmented system we see now. It would be proactive, personalized, and preventative - designed to optimize wellbeing and unlock human potential. Digital-first, tech-powered, with a seamless experience as innovative as Tesla and the cultural impact of Nike. At Healf, we’re not just imagining this future - we’re building it.




Our vision

Health is at a crossroads. Chronic diseases account for 86% of deaths in Europe, yet the healthcare system isn’t designed to provide the preventative, personalized care people need. At Healf, our mission is bold: to put health back in people’s hands. Through curating world-class products and our revolutionary Healf Zone platform, we’re creating a science-driven, personalized approach to preventative care that inspires better living every day. Backed by visionary investors - including those who backed Alo Yoga, Cult Beauty, Innocent Smoothies and Soho House - we’re redefining what health looks like for the world.This isn’t just a business; it’s a movement - a generational opportunity to reshape how we live.




Join us

We’re looking for A+ players - insanely talented, ambitious, and hard-working individuals - ready to build the future of health with us. If you thrive on challenges, dream big, and want to do your life’s best work, we want to hear from you.




Key Responsibilities

Collect, cleanse, cut, and analyse product, commercial, and public data to identify product gaps, data gaps, and commercial opportunities
Develop and iterate on a proprietary Excel model used to analyse products
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs)
Find automated or efficient workarounds to reduce manual effort
Communicate findings and recommendations to Head of Sales Enablement and other stakeholders through dashboards and reports
Document assumptions, acknowledge limitations, and track takeaways from analyses and internal discussions




What we need from you

At least 5 years of experience as a data analyst with experience analysing business data, or in a comparable role such as a financial analyst
Comfortable working with large data sets, ideally in Retail/eCommerce industry
Experience building complex financial or data models in Excel
Expertise in Excel including the use of hotkeys, shortcuts, and complex functions.
Expertise in Google Sheets preferred but not required.
Scripting and experience in other programs such as SQL is a plus, but not required
Extreme attention to detail and sense of ownership, with ability to handle a large amount of responsibility quickly and independently.
Interest in analysing food, supplement, cosmetic, and tech data, with a willingness to learn the details of product regulations in each industry
Project management experience and organisation skills
Remote preferred




You’ll thrive here if you:

Dream big: You’re inspired by solving massive problems and creating transformative change. Tackling challenges that impacts lives excites and motivates you.
Work harder than most: You thrive in a high-performance environment where effort and intensity are the norm. Your passion for what you’re building drives you to give it your all and deliver.
Love to learn: You’re always seeking to grow. Asking questions, embracing feedback, and striving for constant improvement are second nature to you.
Live the Healf lifestyle: Health isn’t just something you practice - it’s who you are. You embody our pillars: EAT, MOVE, MIND, SLEEP, and believe in living and inspiring wellbeing.




Why join Healf?

Do your life’s best work: At Healf, you’ll tackle meaningful challenges that drive real impact.
A+ talent only: We hire for potential over experience. Raw talent, obsessive curiosity, and grit matter more than years of experience. At Healf, you’ll work alongside some of the brightest, most driven individuals in the industry - people who raise the bar every single day.
Energised by what we do: Building something that matters is never easy, but it’s deeply rewarding. We love what we’re creating, and it fuels us to work hard and go above and beyond - not because we have to, but because we want to.
Be a builder: This isn’t a cog-in-the-machine kind of role. You’ll have ownership, autonomy, and the chance to shape the future of health alongside a team that never settles for mediocrity.
Learn from the Best: Work alongside entrepreneurial founders and a mission-driven team, with mentorship that helps you grow into the best version of yourself.




About Us

At Healf, we’re not just a company - we’re a movement. Founded by two brothers whose own health journeys inspired a mission to empower others, Healf is built on grit, determination, and a relentless commitment to excellence.




Our culture is grounded in four commandments that define how we work and win:

1. We Work Harder Than Anyone Else: Building something that improves lives takes long hours, grit, and sacrifice - but we thrive on it. We all feel energised by what we’re building.

2. Never Settle: We challenge the status quo and push ourselves to be better every day. We never settle for mediocrity or the idea that something can’t be done.

3. Obsession Over Talent: Talent alone isn’t enough - relentless curiosity and a drive to grow set us apart.

4. The Healf Lifestyle: We live what we preach - our wellbeing fuels our productivity.




With Healf Zone on the horizon, we’re entering the next phase of our journey: closing the loop on health with personalized, preventative care that unlocks longevity. This is your chance to help build something extraordinary.




Ready to join us?

Apply directly here. Let’s redefine health together.

Show more

Drive Healf’s growth with data. Analyse trends, optimise insights, and build models that power decisions in a fast-scaling eCommerce startup. Join A+ players and do your life’s best work. 🚀


Build the future of Health. Create your life’s best work.

If healthcare were built for today, it wouldn’t resemble the reactive, fragmented system we see now. It would be proactive, personalized, and preventative - designed to optimize wellbeing and unlock human potential. Digital-first, tech-powered, with a seamless experience as innovative as Tesla and the cultural impact of Nike. At Healf, we’re not just imagining this future - we’re building it.


Our vision

Health is at a crossroads. Chronic diseases account for 86% of deaths in Europe, yet the healthcare system isn’t designed to provide the preventative, personalized care people need. At Healf, our mission is bold: to put health back in people’s hands. Through curating world-class products and our revolutionary Healf Zone platform, we’re creating a science-driven, personalized approach to preventative care that inspires better living every day. Backed by visionary investors - including those who backed Alo Yoga, Cult Beauty, Innocent Smoothies and Soho House - we’re redefining what health looks like for the world.This isn’t just a business; it’s a movement - a generational opportunity to reshape how we live.


Join us

We’re looking for A+ players - insanely talented, ambitious, and hard-working individuals - ready to build the future of health with us. If you thrive on challenges, dream big, and want to do your life’s best work, we want to hear from you.


Key Responsibilities

  • Collect, cleanse, cut, and analyse product, commercial, and public data to identify product gaps, data gaps, and commercial opportunities
  • Develop and iterate on a proprietary Excel model used to analyse products
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Find automated or efficient workarounds to reduce manual effort
  • Communicate findings and recommendations to Head of Sales Enablement and other stakeholders through dashboards and reports
  • Document assumptions, acknowledge limitations, and track takeaways from analyses and internal discussions


What we need from you

  • At least 5 years of experience as a data analyst with experience analysing business data, or in a comparable role such as a financial analyst
  • Comfortable working with large data sets, ideally in Retail/eCommerce industry
  • Experience building complex financial or data models in Excel
  • Expertise in Excel including the use of hotkeys, shortcuts, and complex functions.
  • Expertise in Google Sheets preferred but not required.
  • Scripting and experience in other programs such as SQL is a plus, but not required
  • Extreme attention to detail and sense of ownership, with ability to handle a large amount of responsibility quickly and independently.
  • Interest in analysing food, supplement, cosmetic, and tech data, with a willingness to learn the details of product regulations in each industry
  • Project management experience and organisation skills
  • Remote preferred


You’ll thrive here if you:

  • Dream big: You’re inspired by solving massive problems and creating transformative change. Tackling challenges that impacts lives excites and motivates you.
  • Work harder than most: You thrive in a high-performance environment where effort and intensity are the norm. Your passion for what you’re building drives you to give it your all and deliver.
  • Love to learn: You’re always seeking to grow. Asking questions, embracing feedback, and striving for constant improvement are second nature to you.
  • Live the Healf lifestyle: Health isn’t just something you practice - it’s who you are. You embody our pillars: EAT, MOVE, MIND, SLEEP, and believe in living and inspiring wellbeing.


Why join Healf?

  • Do your life’s best work: At Healf, you’ll tackle meaningful challenges that drive real impact.
  • A+ talent only: We hire for potential over experience. Raw talent, obsessive curiosity, and grit matter more than years of experience. At Healf, you’ll work alongside some of the brightest, most driven individuals in the industry - people who raise the bar every single day.
  • Energised by what we do: Building something that matters is never easy, but it’s deeply rewarding. We love what we’re creating, and it fuels us to work hard and go above and beyond - not because we have to, but because we want to.
  • Be a builder: This isn’t a cog-in-the-machine kind of role. You’ll have ownership, autonomy, and the chance to shape the future of health alongside a team that never settles for mediocrity.
  • Learn from the Best: Work alongside entrepreneurial founders and a mission-driven team, with mentorship that helps you grow into the best version of yourself.


About Us

At Healf, we’re not just a company - we’re a movement. Founded by two brothers whose own health journeys inspired a mission to empower others, Healf is built on grit, determination, and a relentless commitment to excellence.


Our culture is grounded in four commandments that define how we work and win:

1. We Work Harder Than Anyone Else: Building something that improves lives takes long hours, grit, and sacrifice - but we thrive on it. We all feel energised by what we’re building.

2. Never Settle: We challenge the status quo and push ourselves to be better every day. We never settle for mediocrity or the idea that something can’t be done.

3. Obsession Over Talent: Talent alone isn’t enough - relentless curiosity and a drive to grow set us apart.

4. The Healf Lifestyle: We live what we preach - our wellbeing fuels our productivity.


With Healf Zone on the horizon, we’re entering the next phase of our journey: closing the loop on health with personalized, preventative care that unlocks longevity. This is your chance to help build something extraordinary.


Ready to join us?

Apply directly here. Let’s redefine health together.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Solutions and Ops
Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

TikTok's Product Solutions & Operations (PSO) team aims to help businesses and brands address their marketing goals through product solutions and also reflecting key insights back to the product teams for product iteration. This role will partner closely with the EUI Strategy and Operations lead to ensure that all projects are completed on time and to the highest standard. This highly organized and efficient professional must be flexible and able to wear multiple hats while working closely with our cross functional teams and prioritising the needs of the team.

Responsibilities

- Responsible for business analysis of Tiktok monetization products. Evaluate business health, identify potential risks and major business opportunities from a regional perspective, using statistical analysis, quantitative attribution and other methods.
- Participate in business goal setting, key direction decision-making and improve internal management efficiency by integrating various data and information based on comprehensive business logic across products, multiple platforms and multiple business forms.
- Design comprehensive metrics framework and execute cadence programs to track milestones, metrics, and goals for key product solutions.
- Provide thought leadership on product data requirements and help capture the right level of data early on to drive product adoption.
- Collaborate with PM, PMM, sales, strategy team and other roles to deliver business and product analysis with clear conclusions and implementation plans, provide decision-making references for leaders and achieve data-driven business growth.
- Provide high-information-density business data insights for leaders and analytical support for day-to-day product-related operational questions



Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- 5+ Years industry experience (preferably in ad tech, agencies, digital marketing) and advanced degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics) or equivalent practical experience.
- Fluency in SQL/Hive, R/Python; experience in using data visualization products; knowledge of quantitative attribution methods.
- Strong curiosity; sensitive to data; good at extracting insights from data.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Commerce industry expertise
- Experience in cross-team cooperation; quickly adapting to complex environments;

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Bath, Bristol, London

Salary: £25,000 - £35,000




About The Company

An innovative start-up bridging the gap between FinTechs, lenders, and investors. Their mission is to connect FinTechs with investors by integrating with their data, analysing potential customer pipelines, and providing investors with reliable insights into future opportunities.




By offering FinTechs access to better funding and investors access to high-quality, standardized data, we’re revolutionizing how capital flows in techs and lenders with investors. By integrating with FinTechs, they analyse data to understand potential customers, assess available information, and provide investors with reliable insights into potential pipelines.




This innovative approach gives FinTechs better access to funding opportunities while enabling investors to make decisions based on high-quality, standardised data. The team is small but highly experienced, with a strong background in finance.




The Role

The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in integrating data from FinTechs, standardising it, and presenting actionable insights to investors. This is a hands-on position where the successful candidate will work closely with large datasets, ensuring data integrity, cleaning, mapping, and creating features that form the foundation of the company’s visualisation tools. These tools are critical for investors making portfolio decisions and for FinTechs monitoring their performance.




Key Responsibilities

Integrating and ingesting credit portfolio data from FinTechs.
Conducting checks on data integrity and mapping to ensure high standards.
Cleaning and standardising data to create meaningful and consistent features.
Building data pipelines and visualisation tools to support client decision-making.
Augmenting data reporting and generating insights to drive business value.




Requirements

At least one year of industry experience, ideally in financial services, insurance, or banking (though other industries will be considered).
A passion for working with data, including large datasets, and deriving insights.
Strong SQL skills are essential.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Domo, Tableau, or similar platforms.
A background in database management or data warehousing is beneficial but not required.
Familiarity with credit data, customer behaviour, and decision models is advantageous.




What We’re Looking For

The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in data and enjoy delving into large datasets to clean, wrangle, and transform them into coherent and visually impactful outputs. They should be motivated by problem-solving and capable of turning complex datasets into actionable insights.




What The Company Offers

The opportunity to join a fast-growing start-up and make a real impact.
A supportive and collaborative team environment.
The flexibility of remote working.
Career growth opportunities as the company scales.




Interview Process

The process will include three stages:

An initial 30-minute interview with the hiring manager.
A practical data task to assess technical skills.
A presentation of the task, showcasing your approach and insights.




How to Apply

If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please apply with your CV or email carlotashepherd@harnham.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
HR Systems & Data Analyst

Location: London (Marylebone) - Hybrid model
Salary: Up to £50,000

About the Role:

We are working with a leading British train operating company. Our client is seeking a HR Systems & Data Analyst to maintain, develop, and support HR information systems while providing key management data and insights. You'll play a pivotal role in enhancing HR processes, automation, and reporting to drive business efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

HR Systems Management - Develop, integrate, and optimize HR systems, providing training and support to stakeholders.
Data & Analytics - Produce and analyse HR reports, identify trends, and ensure data integrity.
System Administration - Oversee system security, GDPR compliance, and support upgrades and enhancements.
Process Improvement - Drive automation and efficiency within HR systems and reporting processes.

What We're Looking For:

Technical Expertise - Experience with iTrent, Business Objects, and Power BI is essential.
Data & Reporting Skills - Strong background in HR analytics, including Excel (pivot tables, v-lookups) and reporting tools.
Problem-Solving Ability - A proactive, analytical thinker who can troubleshoot and recommend system improvements.
Communication & Training - Ability to train and support colleagues in system use.
Flexibility & Attention to Detail - Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver accurate insights.

Why Join?

This is an exciting opportunity to work with a leading organization committed to continuous improvement, innovation, and professional development. Enjoy a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and the chance to shape the future of HR systems.

Title: Senior Data and Reporting Analyst
Description:
About The Role & Team

At Disney, we’re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technological leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavour is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences.

We are seeking an experienced Data & Reporting Analyst to join the Disney Parks team at our EMEA Head Office in Hammersmith. This role combines technical expertise in data analytics with business acumen to drive commercial decisions for Disneyland Paris, Walt Disney World and Disney Cruise Line.

What You Will Do



Design and develop automated reporting solutions using SQL/Python across Snowflake, Streamlit and/or Tableau to provide real-time insights into business performance
Transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights through data visualisation and statistical analysis
Lead the development of self-service analytics tools to empower stakeholders across Disney Destinations International
Analyse cross-channel performance metrics including web analytics, e-commerce data, and marketing campaign effectiveness
Partner with stakeholders to define KPIs and create dashboards that drive business decisions
Maintain data quality standards and implement data governance practices



Data Analysis & Insight



Lead complex cross-platform analysis combining data from multiple sources including website analytics, e-commerce transactions, marketing campaigns, and offline channels
Design and implement A/B tests and multivariate experiments to optimise conversion rates and user experience
Conduct statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities across different markets and segments
Develop predictive models to forecast key business metrics and identify growth opportunities



Reporting & Dashboard Development



Build and maintain automated reporting solutions using Streamlit and/or Tableau
Create interactive dashboards that enable stakeholders to self-serve their data needs
Design custom data visualisations that effectively communicate complex insights to wide audience
Implement data quality checks and automated monitoring systems to ensure reporting accuracy



Stakeholder Collaboration & Data Governance



Partner with business teams to understand their analytical needs and develop appropriate measurement frameworks
Serve as the technical liaison between business stakeholders and data engineering teams
Guide stakeholders in interpreting data and applying insights to business decisions
Maintain comprehensive documentation of data sources, transformations, and business logic in the Disney Parks EMEA Data Dictionary



Platform Management & Innovation



Act as the primary subject matter expert for analytics platforms and tools
Collaborate with third-party vendors and agency partners to optimise data collection and reporting
Evaluate and recommend new analytics tools and methodologies
Lead the migration of legacy reports to modern data stack (Snowflake/Streamlit)



Training and Professional Development



Operate with integrity, champion change and be a good ambassador for DDI and the wider Walt Disney Company (TWDC)
Operate as part of an effective and inclusive team by demonstrating an awareness of others; welcoming and valuing unique perspectives and ideas; offering support, sharing knowledge and best practices in order to contribute to overall departmental commitments
Take ownership of your professional development through regular career conversations with your line manager and utilising available resources such as D Learn, instructor-led courses and on the job learning
Proactively suggest ways to improve departmental performance and processes, leveraging technological tools where applicable
Build links with other TWDC functions to develop broader knowledge of the business
Promote and maintain an inclusive workplace, championing diversity and inclusion and make use of available resources to extend knowledge and best practice



Required Qualifications & Skills



Commercial experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or similar role
Advanced SQL skills with proven experience querying large datasets in cloud data warehouses (Snowflake desirable)
Strong statistical analysis background with focus on digital performance metrics and A/B testing
Demonstrable experience building data pipelines and automated reporting solutions
Expert knowledge of digital analytics platforms, particularly Adobe Analytics & Google Marketing Platform
Track record of translating complex data into actionable business recommendations
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Excellent analytical & numerical kills, including data interrogation and manipulation
Experience with data visualisation tools and techniques, with platform experience in Streamlit or Tableau (desirable), or similar tools.
Experience using SQL (essential) and Python (desirable), to manipulate data, extract insights and create/set up reporting from large volumes of data.
Experience using cloud database (e.g. Snowflake)
Experience with ETL and/or Data Modelling desirable (e.g. DBT, DataOpsLive)
Experience with Version Control and documentation (e.g. Gitlab)
Relevant experience in using statistical analysis to extract insights within and across data sets.
Excellent communication, organisational, presentation and interpersonal skills
Experience with a diverse range of data sources including analytics and marketing platforms, e.g. Adobe analytics, Facebook, Google Marketing Platform.
Flexible approach with a desire to support other parts of the business
Demonstrate expertise through adopting a proactive approach to problem solving, issue resolution and the identification of new approaches



The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.
Show more

Title: Transportation Data Analyst, Citymapper
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we’re on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.




As a Transportation Data Analyst at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application’s success. Your work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.




What You'll Do:

You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.




Who You Are:

You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).




What We Offer:

Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
Competitive salary and comprehensive health scheme offered through AXA
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands




Founded in 2012, Via pioneered the TransitTech category by using new technologies to develop public mobility systems — optimizing networks of buses, shuttles, wheelchair accessible vehicles, school buses, autonomous vehicles, and electric vehicles around the globe.Building the world's most efficient, equitable, and sustainable transportation network for all passengers — including those with limited mobility, those without smartphones, and unbanked populations — Via works with its partners to lower the costs of public transit while providing transportation options that rival the convenience of a personal car while reducing environmental impact.




At the intersection of transportation and technology, Via is a visionary market leader that combines software innovation with sophisticated service design and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves, providing technology in 650 communities and more than 35 countries and counting.




We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?




Via is an equal opportunity employer.

At Citymapper (powered by Via), we’re on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.


As a Transportation Data Analyst at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application’s success. Your work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.


What You'll Do:

  • You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
  • You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
  • You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
  • You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
  • You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:

  • You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
  • You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
  • You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

6 Month contract – Inside IR35 – Up to £350 a day

Slough based – Hybrid Working – 2/3 days office based

Telecoms industry




About the Role:

This role sits in the central Analytics & Insight Chapter and supports our campaign to understand our customers and provide insights and actionable recommendations that help to achieve our business objectives

The position will require a solid understanding of SQL and technical skills, so that you are able to mine internal data and provide highly actionable insight to the business. Cleansing and maintenance of a set of analytics data views for onward use in insights, BI reporting and campaign performance measurement will be integral to the role.

You will work very closely with your squad's Value Lead and other stakeholders to understand their needs and objectives and then implement appropriate solutions. The role also requires close collaboration with fellow data analysts and a strong understanding of our business fundamentals.

You will be strong at relationship building and communication to ensure that briefs are stress tested to provide maximum value to customers. Presenting findings expertly and influencing stakeholders will also be a key focus.




Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst you will:

Receive and develop briefs from your Value Lead and work collaboratively to ensure work of the highest quality
Maintain analytics data views for accurate reporting and insights capability - Maintain and update stored procedures
Combine internal data with other data sources to provide a holistic view
Participate in all squad ceremonies and events, raising impediments as soon as identified to facilitate delivery
Inspect and adapt your way of working for continuous improvement
Embody an Agile mindset and culture to contribute to the growth in agile maturity of our business
Provide accurate, insightful and timely analysis to the business to help them make better decisions and enable the client to serve its customers a little better every day
Ability to simplify the complex and generate precise insights then communicate them clearly.
Continually look to improve processes through efficiencies and by applying best practice
Challenge the stakeholders and the business backlogs to focus work around the areas that really matter
Actively add to the Squads backlog with work that would benefit customers
Steer the agenda and be a trusted partner for work
Ability to contribute to an analytics roadmap for continuous insight delivery improvement




Skills & Experience Required:

Strong interpersonal skills so that you can work closely with the squads you support
Skilled at adapting communication for both technical and non-technical audiences
Able to learn data sources and methodologies quickly and apply technical skills to curate accurate analytics data views
Familiarity with GitHub and quality assurance checking of SQL scripts
Experience in obtaining insight from large data sets and sharing actionable learnings with the wider business
2 years+ experience in coding complex SQL queries against a large relational customer database, identifying relevant data sources and summarising to provide the insight as identified
Experience in updating SQL stored procedures
Ability to resolve data-related problems
Proficiency in Python and / or R a bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities

Our People Solutions team are looking for bright, enthusiastic and articulate candidates keen to gain experience and start their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive and attention to detail essential.

The successful candidates will be working closely with other analysts to learn the role and to support on the day-to-day needs.

You will be provided with structured and ‘on-the-job’ training, support with professional qualifications.


Manage, cleanse, and interpret internal data as well as client data.
Responsible for monthly uploads of claims and membership data.
Develop internal models.
Develop PowerBI dashboards for internal and external purposes.
Deliver claims forecasts on PMI and assist the actuarial team.
Carry out ad-hoc projects, across all lines of business, to support the business where possible.
Internal ‘go-to’ for excel support, client and internal ad-hoc requests.
Responsible for financial reporting for the People Solutions Executive Team


Qualifications


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong interest in programming languages such as DAX/VBA, R/Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Thorough and great attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Interest in the healthcare and risk market

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Simply Business helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Simply Business is an online business insurance brokerage that specialises in one thing: protecting the businesses their customers are working hard to build. Since they started life in 2005, they have helped over three million small businesses and self-employed people find the protection that’s right for them, from builders to bakers and personal trainers. Their big idea was to reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible, while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that they believe small businesses and landlords are entitled to.




Their story - continued commitment to doing the right thing




2005 seems like a long time ago. Simply Business – a small company with a big idea. To transform the way that other small businesses could get the insurance that they need. To reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that small businesses are entitled to. To protect them from harm. To keep their livelihoods safe. And to do all this with the promise of positive service. Delivered by happy people, working flexibly, learning constantly. With a restlessly innovative spirit. Within a business committed to doing the right thing. All of the time.




As they've grown, they've tried hard to keep true to this. To ourselves, to their 800 strong team and to the 3.5m customers that they've served so far. And as they move forward, as they enter a big new market, as they grow responsibly, as they improve their products, as they offer their customers more of what they need, of what they deserve, they'll hold onto the focus of that small company with the big idea. Protecting and serving businesses across the UK and the US. From barbers to bakers, consultants to cleaners, they are the backbone of the economy.




And they'll continue to stand by them. Bit by bit helping their dreams grow, just like ours.




Why do they need this role?




This role will sit within the global Data and Analytics team (DNA) in Simply Business. DNA has been central to empowering data-driven decision making at SB. They have invested heavily in their data pipeline, data engineering and their business intelligence capabilities.
In 2023 and beyond, they will continue investing a significant amount of effort in ramping up their Business Intelligence capabilities to drive business decisions.
The primary duty of this role will be to provide analytical support for their business stakeholders. This includes leading the measurement and evaluation of their product value streams and ensuring that they continuously improve the effectiveness of their product investments. Success in this role will require you to be a trusted advisor to their business partners, ensuring they focus their efforts on the most value-added insights initiatives.




In this role, you will:




Create data models in their Snowflake data warehouse
Integrate new sources of data to enrich their analytical capabilities
Work with the engineering and product teams to ensure application design accommodates reporting and analytics requirements
Work with various business and engineering teams to ensure reliable, scalable, robust architecture for their analytics platform and ETL pipelines
Partner with stakeholders to identify business use cases and translate them into the right analytical problem that you will build, test and productionize
Particular focus will be on use cases that will help them drive operational efficiencies as the organization scales.
Increase the organization's ability to convert more customers.
Clearly communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Contribute to longer term strategic DNA projects




What are they looking for:




At least 3 years of overall experience in data & analytics, operational analytics experience is desired;
Degree with analytics or software engineering experience or equivalent work experience;
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake or similar;
Experience designing and creating SQL data models using dbt (dbt Certification a plus);
Strong communication and data presentation skills through the use of effective data visualisation and BI tools, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc;
Effective at building strong, influential relationships with colleagues and partners, with demonstrated success in delivering impactful insights to executives;
Self-starter who is comfortable working in a globally distributed team environment
Experience in Python or another programming language (e.g. Kotlin, Scala, Ruby) is welcomed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Risk & Fraud




Location: Remote (London Rate)

Fixed-Term Contract (Initially 6 Months)




Experience Level: Mid-Senior (approx. 5-7 years)

Approx. £104,000 (Plus Benefits)




Job Overview




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualization, Python, and risk & fraud analytics. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in leveraging data-driven insights to detect fraud, assess risks, and enhance decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, providing analytical support and developing models to identify patterns of fraudulent activity.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large datasets to detect fraud patterns, anomalies, and risk trends.
Develop and maintain SQL queries, dashboards, and reports to support fraud detection and risk assessment.
Create data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to communicate insights effectively.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and building fraud detection models.
Collaborate with risk, compliance, and engineering teams to enhance fraud mitigation strategies.
Monitor transaction data and develop predictive models to proactively identify potential fraud cases.
Provide actionable insights through exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and compliance with industry regulations.




Required Qualifications & Skills




5-7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in risk, fraud, or financial services.
Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large datasets.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent).
Hands-on experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with fraud detection techniques, risk scoring, and anomaly detection.
Experience working with large-scale transactional data and real-time fraud analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data patterns.
Excellent communication skills to present insights to stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience with machine learning models for fraud detection.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance in fraud prevention.
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Background in finance, banking, or e-commerce fraud analytics.




Why Join Us?




Work on impactful projects that combat fraud and enhance risk management.

Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** Open Source Data Analyst **

** £36,320 - £44,614 **

** Hybrid Working **

** Locations - Croydon and Nottingham **




Our Open Source Data Analysts need to have a passion for data analysis, and an inquiring and questioning mind. The ability to understand and solve problems is essential. You’ll use a range of analytical techniques to gain an understanding of unfamiliar and complex issues, identify relevant information and put it into context when making sound conclusions.




These exciting posts are within the Open Source Data Analysis team, part of Risk Insight & Analytics within the Risk and Intelligence Service. The Open Source Data Analysis team uses a bespoke cloud based private network and a variety of tools that enables the team to access all areas of the web, identify relevant data and analyse it.




Our data analysts use techniques from a range of analytical disciplines to combine, understand and visualise web derived data within a business context. We provide robust Open Source data analysis in a suite of products tailored to business needs and that can be used to inform business decisions and policy. Our analysis enhances the way the department understands, identifies and tackles risk to revenue.




Our ability to safely and legally search the internet to capture, analyse and exploit Open Source data from all areas of the web places us in a unique position to offer a different perspective and insight on issues that impact on tax compliant behaviour now and in the future.




About HMRC




HMRC is the UK’s tax, payments, and customs authority, and we have a vital purpose: we collect the money that pays for the UK’s public services and help families and individuals with targeted financial support. We are one of the UK’s largest organisations, with around 66,000 employees, collecting over £605 billion in tax revenue.




About the Risk & Intelligence Service (RIS)




RIS collects, integrates and analyses one of the largest and most diverse range of data and intelligence in the world. This enables HMRC to understand and manage risks associated with non-compliance with the UK tax system.




Job description




The team has three core functions:

Horizon Scanning: Identification of broad trends in web technologies, e-commerce and digital developments that impact on the department’s strategic objectives.
Data Insight: complex data collection, interpretation and analysis of compliance populations and/or specific elements of serious non-compliant behaviour to inform tactical and operational decision making.
Social Media Insight: analysis of social media platforms, their use and growth, the sentiment and language used across them and the compliance behaviour exhibited in reaction to changes in HMRC’s approach to compliance and/or legislative change.

We work with our stakeholders and customers to understand their requirements, develop and deliver bespoke solutions and suggest new ideas to support them.

Employing analytical skills to design and deliver products that inform a diverse customer base within HMRC.




Person specification

The successful candidate will:

Be proficient in using applications to manipulate multiple data sets. For example, using Excel to merge, analyse and consolidate data using pivot tables, functions and charts.
Be comfortable in learning to use new tools and work with large datasets, including unstructured data, government, public and commercially available data.
Be a good communicator, able to work with multiple customers to understand their requirements, balance conflicting demands and provide progress updates.
Be adept at explaining and simplifying technical analysis in a manner that enables others to understand and act on analytical outcomes.
Have excellent organisational and strong literacy and interpersonal skills, able to work as part of a wider team and individually taking responsibility for delivering high quality analytical products.




Desirable Criteria:

Practical experience of using any of the following tools and languages to analyse and manipulate data is desirable: R, Python or similar.
A background in formal mathematics and / or statistical training (statistics, mathematics, pure sciences, computer science).
Undertaken technical analytical roles and practical experience of data analysis or intelligence.

  • Undertaken technical analytical roles and practical experience of data analysis or intelligence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Titan Group provides a broad range of services across the whole wealth value chain – from financial planning, investment management through to platform, trading, settlement and custody services. Its strategy is to be able to offer modular, incremental services to its clients allowing them to adjust their business models as and when they choose to. As part of this Titan is also an active acquirer of UK based asset managers and other wealth related businesses.

Due to this Titan Wealth is expanding rapidly through strategic acquisitions, offering a unique combination of start-up energy and the security of private equity backing. It’s an inspiring time to join the team!

The primary purpose of this role is to contribute to the roadmap and data strategy to enable the organisation to reach their goal of being data driven. This includes development of processes and metrics that create efficiencies and expand company’s analytical capabilities.

Job Responsibilities


Be able to input from designing processes, to building scalable tools and robust data sources
Proactively engage with other departments to support wider data strategy
Understand and interrogate the data, providing challenge, if necessary, to the team
Contribute to thought leadership and trend analysis
Monitor and troubleshoot processes, identify issues, and implement solutions to ensure data integrity and efficiency
Pioneer analytical techniques focusing on investment analytics and data science
Maintenance, standardisation and quality control of the third-party data
Contribute to the data projects which are being undertaken by the Titan Data Services team



Job Requirements


Educated to degree level, holding a Maths or Science-based degree and/or relevant professional qualification
Coding, investment, and database management experience is essential
Sound knowledge of investment terminology and statistical analysis
Proficiency in programming languages, especially Python
Experience in using data visualisation software, such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge operating with Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards is welcome as is experience with Microsoft Azure and DevOps
Good understanding of the business processes required to support customers and internal stakeholders
Good project management skills and ability to analyse large amounts of information quickly
Attention to detail



Our employees are talented people, distinguished by excellence. You will be able to demonstrate a willingness to embrace the Company values of:

Professionalism - how we treat our clients and colleagues.

Trust - embrace innovation and adapt to change.

Innovation - dare to create and don't fear failure.

Terms

Competitive salary

Hybrid working

25 days annual leave + public holidays

A range of benefits which includes private medical insurance, Group life insurance, and income protection insurance.

6% employer pension contribution

Further education and training support

Discretionary performance related bonus

Confidential Employee Assistance Programme

2 days per year for voluntary work

“Salary Extras” employee discounts

The Titan Wealth Group is firmly committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable environment for everyone who works with us, regardless of their race, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, physical ability or disability, or political affiliation. We believe that having a diverse team allows us to create the best possible outcomes for our clients and team members. We strive to provide equal opportunities in all aspects of the workplace with respect to recruitment and career advancement, pay and benefits, training and development opportunities and other job-related activities.

Title: Data Analyst (Operations)
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 111 million registered users and 237,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 410+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.107.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with a dedicated team of analysts who are working with finance and marketing to improve reporting and build data products for key use cases.

Your role


Support business stakeholders in defining and leveraging data products that drive decision-making.
Collaborate with your analyst team to own and manage the data roadmap for finance and marketing.
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function.
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects.


Requirements


You have previous experience in an analytical role
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You are proficient in SQL
You are excited by the opportunity to work with and learn about DBT and Redshift


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Product Analyst, Direct-to-Consumer
Description:
Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

Job Description

Our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal, and Sky. When you join our team, you’ll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, Fandango, SkyShowtime, Showmax, and TV Everywhere, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. And the evolution doesn’t stop there. With unequaled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth, and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

NBCUniversal is looking for highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will contribute to the evolution of our data platform into a truly international product. Partnership with international teams and openness to the latest ideas in data technology is essential to the success of the role.

As a member of the Decision Sciences team, highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis. As a Data Product Analyst, you will play a critical role in guiding product development and strategy through data-driven insights.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform product decisions and strategies.
Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to develop data-driven strategies that enhance product performance and user experience.
Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement and suggesting actionable solutions.
Conduct competitive analysis and market research to understand industry trends and inform product development.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, and sales, to ensure data-driven product development.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by implementing robust data governance practices.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or engineering, or focus on data/statistical analysis or equivalent experience highly desired
3 – 5 years of experience working with complex data sets across a broad range of domains. Knowledge of financial, video streaming and analytical data sets such as Adobe will be advantageous.
Detail and results oriented, able to write detailed specs and analyze data to justify product decisions, and apply key learnings
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Understanding of business strategy and product management principles.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.


Desired Characteristics


Creative problem-solver; takes a high level of initiative, has a strong sense of personal accountability to follow-through at all times.
Demonstrates organizational savvy by successfully navigating complex, highly matrixed and decentralized organization.
Takes an informed and inspired view to deliver superior results by creating value and opportunity.
A bias for getting the job done


Additional Information

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.
