  • Gather, extract and clean data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and quality.
  • Analyze large datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Convert data-driven insights into practical business suggestions, assisting collaborators in comprehending and addressing key challenges and opportunities.
  • Build visually appealing and insightful data visualizations in Power BI to communicate sophisticated data analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by conducting regular data audits and performing validation checks.
  • Continuously seek and implement improvements in data collection, analysis, and reporting to enhance overall efficiency and effectiveness.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Proficient in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, and seaborn for data manipulation and visualization.
  • Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL for data querying.
  • Experience creating dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools.
  • Experience in front-line customer service or technical support, with superb communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical collaborators.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle challenges and seek guidance when needed.
  • Must be enrolled in a recognized and accredited co-op program at a Canadian post-secondary institution throughout the duration of the term, available for full-time work, and willing to relocate to Vancouver, BC if currently studying outside of Metro Vancouver.

Nice to Have

  • Understanding of how to use RESTful APIs. Familiarity with authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth 2.0, SAML 2.0, SCIM).
  • Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and their benefits, enabling effective collaboration, adaptability, and continuous improvement within a team environment.
  • Familiarity with Azure DevOps and other agile tools for project management.

Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job – we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing a fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to: 

  • Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
  • Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
  • Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
  • Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation

Salary Range: $3900 - $4900 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

About Teck

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Teck is one of Canada's leading mining companies, focused on providing products that are essential to building a better quality of life for people around the globe.

Our commitment to our people is why Teck has been named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for seven consecutive years, listed as one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People and named to the 2024 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business and we are proud to be recognized as one of the 2024 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations by Corporate Knights.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, Data Digital Enablement, the Data Engineering Analyst will collaborate closely with the Data Architect to ensure the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data operations and cloud platform. This role will actively participate in maintaining and optimizing the organization’s data ecosystem. The Data Engineering Analyst demonstrates exceptional professionalism, initiative, and a proactive approach to challenges. They bring strong creative and analytical problem-solving skills, consistently deliver high-quality work within deadlines, contribute positively to team success, and embrace opportunities for continuous learning and growth.

Note: This position qualifies for an optional hybrid work schedule after 90 days of onsite work and onboarding. Employee will be subject to the terms of the Flexible Work Policy Agreement.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure Support


Assists in ensuring the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data infrastructure.
Collaborates with the Data Architect in designing, implementing, and optimizing scalable data infrastructure solutions within Microsoft's technology stack.
Monitors, troubleshoots, and debugs issues affecting the performance of the data infrastructure and its assets.
Develops root-cause analysis for incidents and contributes to lessons learned.
Supports the management and maintenance of the organization's data warehouse and lake house, ensuring its reliability, security, and operational efficiency.
Enhances existing infrastructure, solutions, and processes to meet technical standards and address business requirements.



ETL and Data Integration


Develop and supports the implementation of end-to-end ETL processes for data procurement and integration.
Collaborates with the team to continuously monitor, tune, and optimize the performance of data pipelines, databases, and datasets.
Actively participates in defining and implementing efficient data engineering workflows.



Data Modeling and Quality


Supports best practices in data modeling methodologies for the design and implementation of effective datasets.
Supports the establishment and enforcement of data quality standards and practices to ensure accuracy and reliability throughout the data life cycle.
Develops data quality monitoring, alerting, and profiling processes.
Collaborates with stakeholders to define and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs.



Documentation and Communication


Writes and maintains comprehensive documentation of the requirements collected, data infrastructure, data source catalogs, data models, ETL runbooks, and data quality standards.
Works closely with stakeholders to understand use cases and ensure developed data products meet their needs.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating technical concepts into understandable terms.



Project Collaboration


Supports the implementation of the Data and Digital Enablement Program’s roadmap.
Participates in Scrum ceremonies as part of the Data and Digital Enablement team.
Actively contributes towards data engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Works towards maintaining high standards in Seaspan Marine Group’s data engineering processes, aligning with industry best practices.



What You'll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Business Administration, or completion of a Post-secondary Diploma in Computer Science.
Minimum 2-3 years of experience as a Data Engineer in an environment using the Azure technology stack.
Familiarity with designing and building ETL mechanisms in Azure.
Proficiency in coding languages such as PowerShell, Python, SQL, Java, and Scala.
Experience using IDEs such as VS or VS Code for development and Git for version control.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and version control practices.
Understanding of data concepts, databases, data modeling, dimensional modeling, and star schemas.
Experience with physical and logical design of database architectures for relational databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Knowledge of database optimization, disaster recovery, and ETL performance tuning.
Solid working knowledge in Azure Data Factory, ADLS GEN2 and TSQL.
Exposure to Spark and Databricks in Azure is an asset.
Developing and maintaining integrations in Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).
Working knowledge of Data Engineering components in Microsoft Fabric.



Why you'll love working here


This is a full-time, permanent position. With multiple operations and long-term projects, Seaspan employees enjoy job stability as we look ahead to build ships for decades to come.
In addition to an annual bonus and pension plan matching, this role provides you a very competitive salary in line with the successful candidate’s experience.
We also provide a best-in-class health and wellness benefits package for this position, including such things as full health care (e.g. unlimited physiotherapy), dental, vision, life insurance, medical leave coverage, parental leave coverage, childcare benefit partnership, wellness/fitness reimbursement for memberships or registration fees, and an Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP).



The estimated salary for this position is $72,900 - $87,400. In determining final salary, Seaspan considers many factors including the successful Candidate’s skillset and experience as well as position location and internal equity. The final base salary offer will be at the Company’s sole discretion and presented as part of a competitive total compensation package.

About Us

With more than 130 years of experience navigating in some of the world’s most complex and difficult waters, Seaspan Marine is the largest and most diverse tug & barge company on Canada’s West Coast.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).

We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC’s Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.

We work hybrid at Plenty of Fish - IRL in our downtown Vancouver office on Tuesday and Wednesday and work remotely the remainder of the week!




We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to uncover engagement trends, optimize user experience, and shape product strategy at POF. If you thrive on solving complex problems, analyzing large datasets, and translating insights into compelling stories, we want to hear from you!

Your primary focus will be user engagement, but you’ll also collaborate with teams across monetization, marketing, and trust & safety, working alongside data analysts in those areas.

You’ll lead experimentation efforts, designing and analyzing A/B tests to enhance user retention and product performance. Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, UX Designers, and Data Engineers, you’ll translate data into actionable strategies and present insights to executives to drive high-impact decisions.

As part of Match Group, you’ll also connect with data professionals across other leading dating brands, gaining exposure to industry best practices and expanding your expertise.




So, what will you do?
Design, execute, and analyze experiments to improve user engagement and retention
Work with large-scale datasets to uncover user behaviour trends and optimize key features
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for product teams and executives
Partner with Product, Engineering, UX, and Marketing to drive data-informed decision-making
Work alongside other data analysts supporting monetization, marketing, and trust & safety
Present findings to leadership, shaping company-wide initiatives and priorities




You'll be a match for this role if you have..
4+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably in tech, SaaS, or consumer-facing platforms
Experience with raw clickstream data (telemetry event data) and handling datasets of 100M+ records
Strong expertise in A/B testing, experimentation methodologies, and statistical analysis
Proficiency in SQL and experience with Python for data analysis
Experience working with large-scale datasets in a fast-moving, data-rich environment
Strong business intuition - the ability to connect the dots between data and strategy
Excellent communication skills - comfortable presenting insights to leadership







**We would love to hear from you, even if you don't match 100% of the requirements**

Why Plenty of Fish?

• We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2023!

• Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days 

• RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan 

• Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from day one

• Match Group mentorship program

• Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits

• Extended health & dental benefits from day one

• Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits 

• And many more on our careers page

Our Values

• Be Proud - We own our ship. We see challenges as opportunities and take action.

• Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.

• Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface thoughtful decisions.

• Crew Together - We're all working towards the same goals and win as a team.

Want To Dive Deeper?

LinkedIn

Glassdoor

We’re committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law.  Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please speak to your recruiter directly.

#PoF



Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English
You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Show more

Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

HTML:
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English
  • You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
  • Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
  • You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
  • Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
  • Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

  • Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
  • Better work-life balance
  • Be your own boss
  • Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
  • Be part of an online community



TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

Join a company that has been a part of moving Metro Vancouver for over 35 years.

British Columbia Rapid Transit Company Ltd. (BCRTC) maintains and operates the Expo and Millennium SkyTrain Lines from our central facilities in south Burnaby. Our services connect downtown Vancouver to the cities of Burnaby, New Westminster, Coquitlam, Port Moody and Surrey. With the future expansion of both the Expo and Millennium Lines gathering pace, infrastructure renewal and new asset acquisition projects underway, this is an exciting time to join our team of over 1,200 dedicated employees, working on one of the longest fully-automated rapid transit systems in the world.

Our work encompasses roles such as administration, engineering, elevator and escalator maintenance, field operations, vehicle maintenance, and wayside (station and guideway) maintenance.

When you work for SkyTrain, not only will you help move Metro Vancouver, you will also have access to comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, medical benefits, transit passes, training and more. We are a proud equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Come explore what makes us one of BC’s Top Employers!

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Develops, coordinates and maintains performance measures across the organization to ensure alignment with corporate

goals and objectives. Prepares a variety of analyses and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information to the

management team.

Develops and maintains end-to-end data and analytics solutions to meet BCRTC’s business needs and support data-driven decision-making strategies. This includes identifying analytical goals and objectives through stakeholder engagement, developing data collection solutions, creating automated Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes, generating meaningful performance insights, and communicating analytical insights to various stakeholders through data visualization tools and data storytelling.

Key Accountabilities

Performance Measures & Continuous Improvement:

Collaborates with departments to explore data requirements and works with relevant managers/supervisors to develop business performance tracking and analytical solutions across all functions. Engages with relevant stakeholders in requirements gathering, data tracking, report design, delivery and sustainment.

Investigates and analyzes statistics and underlying causes and trends of business performance. Prepares periodic reports indicating business performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances. Supports all corporate KPI reporting activities for various levels of management, BCRTC Board of Directors, and TransLink.

Establishes and maintains data collection, verification, and reporting processes which ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of the analytical insights. Ensures solutions are reliable and comply with company’s standards, policies, processes, regulatory and other related requirements.

Leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices and provides comparable performance measures from other transit agencies and business enterprises to the concerned stakeholders towards informed decision making. Participates in annual benchmarking KPI data submission activities.

Supports corporate data & insights-driven initiatives and business planning activities as needed, e.g. Annual Performance Target Setting, Data Quality Improvement, Data Value Creation Initiatives and Data Management framework.

Supports the design, implementation, and maintenance of pipelines for data integration and ETL/ELT on modern data platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, and PowerBI.

Supports the manager to produce reports and statistical analyses for targeted areas in response to requests from media, Freedom of Information requests, Executive team, BCRTC management and supervisors.

Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) Services

Provides analytical services as requested from leaders across the organization on divisional and departmental level BI&A reporting, business process digitization and automation. Ensures end users have the information needed to manage their business performance to support a culture of continuous improvement.

Designs, implements, and maintains end-to-end analytical solutions for BCRTC internal clients using modern BI platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, PowerApp, PowerAutomate, and Power BI. Ensures designed solutions are fit for purpose, cost-effective, align with standards, policies and support ongoing data & insights-driven initiatives within BCRTC. Ensures that solutions are reusable and scalable following best practices, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Processes sensitive workforce data and develops relevant BI solutions according to enterprise policies and guidelines. Supports the completion of requisite Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) completion for the developed data and analytics solutions.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Management, Data Analytics, Engineering, or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience with design, implementation and maintenance of data and creation of reports in a Business Intelligence environment. Master’s, Doctorate degrees, and Professional Certifications in related fields may be considered as equivalent to practical experience. Experience supporting data management or data governance programs, or in workforce-related analytics for occupational health, safety, workforce productivity and other HR analytics would be considered an asset.

Other Requirements

Solid understanding of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards.

Advanced knowledge of developing Microsoft Analytics solutions including PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI, Azure Synapse and Fabric. Demonstrated experience in programming languages is required: e.g. SQL, R, Python.

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and diagnose data quality issues.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Ability to listen and interpret stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Resident

This position works predominately on-site.

Rate of Pay

Salary: $75,600 - $113,400 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: January 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

SkyTrain is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Data Enginner
Description:
Our direct client, a leader in the global travel industry including being well known in global travel analytics, is seeking a Data Engineer/Analyst with Python, Power BI, SQL and knowledge of Azure where you will be supporting their team with dashboard expertise, advanced data analysis and support of the day-to-day business with data inquiries.




Specific duties will require a strong background using the Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite, with an emphasis on Power BI, SQL and database architecture. The qualified candidate should have 3 to 5 years of relevant experience.




This is an outstanding opportunity to work for a Microsoft Power BI partner!




Note:This is a data exploration role – data discovery, uncover data patterns and trends, analysis to get to root cause in order to influence future change and success




Responsibilities:




Expertise in data projects including data gathering, modeling, analysis, presentation, monitoring, and iterating on improvements
Data Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of complex data, identifying trends, and translating insights into actionable recommendations.
SQL and Database Management: Leverage SQL skills to query, manipulate and manage data within relational databases.
Power BI Development: Design, develop, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports andensure they are intuitive, efficient, and tailored to the client's needs.
Select and engineer features based on mining massive data sets
Ability to use statistical, machine learning techniques to build models that address business needs







Skills Required:




Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics.
3-5 years of Data Engineering/Analyst experience.
Strong research, analytical, math, and logic abilities
Database experience with SQL Server or similar platform
Experience with Power BI and Python REQUIRED
Experience with Azure-based data engineering
Data Warehousing, Data Mart and database technologies, standards, and methodologies
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Analysis and design skills, critical thinking, and analytical problem solving
Ability to analyze data anomalies
Ability to work well cross functionally, especially with technical teams
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, handle a diverse workload, and meet aggressive deadlines.
Any experience in the travel industry is a plus

Title: Data Engineer Co-op
Description:
Who we are:

We are a bunch of people who really care about agriculture, food and the challenges facing farming. We want to help farmers with data driven decision making to help nature feed a growing population. Join our team of expert engineers, agronomists, entomologists, crop researchers, and data scientists who are continually conducting research to help drive innovation in agriculture.

Semios is a market leader in leveraging the internet-of-things (IoT) and big data to improve the sustainability and profitability of specialty crops. With 500 million data points being reported by our sensors every day, we leverage our big data analytics, such as in-depth pest and disease modeling, to empower tree fruit and tree nut growers with decision-making tools to minimize resources and risks.

Our innovative work has received several industry awards:


AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2023) - Selected as winner of the "Overall Smart Irrigation Company Of The Year" award
Sustainability Changemaker by SDTC (2022) - Named as one of the companies which recognize homegrown innovation in sustainable technologies in Canada
AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2021) - Selected as winner of the "Pest Management Solutions of the Year" award
Google Accelerator (2020) - Selected as 1 of 9 companies for the inaugural Google for Startups Accelerator Canada cohort, who are all using technology to solve complex challenges
Global CleanTech Top 100 (2020) - Identified as one of the companies best positioned to solve tomorrow's clean technology challenges


One of our partners produced this short video which shows what we do and our positive environmental impact.

We know our journey is only achievable by having a great team that shares ideas, tries new things and learns as we go.

Who you are:

Motivated by meaningful work, you are looking for a collaborative, team environment with the opportunity to learn and grow as you take the initiative to try new things for May2025.

As a Data Engineer Co-op, you will be part of building the most integrated data platform in Agriculture, which means joining information from many sources. Your job is to build pipelines and supporting tools to combine and deliver the data in a timely manner for the customer

What you will do:


You'll work with our internal Data Engineers and Data Scientists to find the most efficient way to ingest, extract, and process new data sources
Look for opportunities to reduce platform costs and optimize queries
Along the way, you'll become an automation guru, play a role in our big data platform, and our new AI tooling; deliver tangible results by the end of your term
You'll gain wide exposure to SQL, DBT, Dagster, and time-series databases like Google BigQuery, and Postgres
You'll help monitor the health of our data platform using Mode and Grafana.



Requirements


We want you to succeed, so you will need:


You're working towards a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math or similar fields
You have experience in SQL
You're organized, independent, and detail-oriented. You love to finish a project knowing you've been thorough and delivered the goods
You have some exposure to cloud computing, emerging AI technologies, and databases
You are interested in contributing to pipelines in a large-scale data environment
You're excited to learn and understand agriculture and what drives the food supply that feeds our planet



Salary Range: $18 to $22.00 per hour.

Please note that the pay rate offered may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and experience, as well as business and organizational needs.

Benefits


Sleep better, knowing you're making the world a better place through more sustainable food production
Collaborative and casual work environment
Opportunity to learn and make an impact by working on meaningful projects
Tech-focused office location, convenient to transit and bike paths
You enjoy the hybrid working environment - the flexibility of working from home some days and the personal connections built from working in the office


Semios welcomes all applicants regardless of race, gender, orientation, sexual identity, economic class, ability, disability, age, religious beliefs or disbeliefs, or status. We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish and we welcome everyone.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning
Description:
Department: Supply Planning

Reports to: Director, Supply Planning

Your opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

The Digital Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning works with cross-functional teams to analyze data, monitor performance metrics, and provide valuable insights to enhance overall supply planning performance. You will contribute to the achievement of KPI goals, identify areas for improvement, and support data-driven decision-making across various departments.

 

This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid or remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

 

Meet your future team:

The Supply Planning team is dynamic group of high-level planners who are responsible for the development and on-time delivery of the supply plan to warehouse.  Our planners partner with internal and external teams to identify and mitigate supply risks, manage production readiness, prioritize business requirements, and reconcile gaps in delivery.




If you were in this position now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Gathering business questions and translating them into data requirements and specifications
Extracting and analyzing data from various platforms, such as SAP, AFO, and other data collection platforms
Monitoring and analyzing supply chain data performance to KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement and risks in on time delivery
Preparing regular reports and dashboards summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations for stakeholders and management to inform decision-making processes
Developing and maintaining documentation of analyses and insights to continuously build and develop data analysis process across supply planning
Monitoring and reporting on outcomes of improvements and progress against performance goals
Conducting ad hoc analysis, as required, for cross-functional partners to drive end to end Supply Chain on time delivery
Supporting training of colleagues and internal partners in their use of digital analytics to answer their business questions and develop standardized analytics processes
Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and integrity across systems and analysis data points




Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Evaluating data-related process gaps across the Supply Planning and cross-functional departments, summarizing and proposing recommendations to Supply leaders for continuous process evolution
Contributing to the evolution of data tools across the business, providing subject matter expertise in future development of data platforms




Are you our next Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning?
You have 4+ years of experience as a Digital Analyst or similar role, preferably within supply chain
You have a University degree in Math, Economic, Statistics, Finance, Business or equivalent
You have strong analytical skills with a proven track record of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets
You have an understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness
You have strong expertise in SAP systems, particularly SAP Retail, SAP ERP, and SAP Master Data Governance (MDG).
High proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
You have an extreme attention to detail and an ability to dig into large amounts of data and find the inconsistencies and risks
You have strong communication and business presentation skills, ability to effectively communicate to all levels of stakeholders
Familiarity with retail operations, including product management, pricing, and supply chain processes, is highly desirable.
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it







Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 

Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$70,000 - CAD$97,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

HTML:
Department: Supply Planning

Reports to: Director, Supply Planning

Your opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

The Digital Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning works with cross-functional teams to analyze data, monitor performance metrics, and provide valuable insights to enhance overall supply planning performance. You will contribute to the achievement of KPI goals, identify areas for improvement, and support data-driven decision-making across various departments.

 

This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid or remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

 

Meet your future team:

The Supply Planning team is dynamic group of high-level planners who are responsible for the development and on-time delivery of the supply plan to warehouse.  Our planners partner with internal and external teams to identify and mitigate supply risks, manage production readiness, prioritize business requirements, and reconcile gaps in delivery.


If you were in this position now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
  • Gathering business questions and translating them into data requirements and specifications
  • Extracting and analyzing data from various platforms, such as SAP, AFO, and other data collection platforms
  • Monitoring and analyzing supply chain data performance to KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement and risks in on time delivery
  • Preparing regular reports and dashboards summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations for stakeholders and management to inform decision-making processes
  • Developing and maintaining documentation of analyses and insights to continuously build and develop data analysis process across supply planning
  • Monitoring and reporting on outcomes of improvements and progress against performance goals
  • Conducting ad hoc analysis, as required, for cross-functional partners to drive end to end Supply Chain on time delivery
  • Supporting training of colleagues and internal partners in their use of digital analytics to answer their business questions and develop standardized analytics processes
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and integrity across systems and analysis data points


Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
  • Evaluating data-related process gaps across the Supply Planning and cross-functional departments, summarizing and proposing recommendations to Supply leaders for continuous process evolution
  • Contributing to the evolution of data tools across the business, providing subject matter expertise in future development of data platforms


Are you our next Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning?
  • You have 4+ years of experience as a Digital Analyst or similar role, preferably within supply chain
  • You have a University degree in Math, Economic, Statistics, Finance, Business or equivalent
  • You have strong analytical skills with a proven track record of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets
  • You have an understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness
  • You have strong expertise in SAP systems, particularly SAP Retail, SAP ERP, and SAP Master Data Governance (MDG).
  • High proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • You have an extreme attention to detail and an ability to dig into large amounts of data and find the inconsistencies and risks
  • You have strong communication and business presentation skills, ability to effectively communicate to all levels of stakeholders
  • Familiarity with retail operations, including product management, pricing, and supply chain processes, is highly desirable.
  • You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
  • You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
  • You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
  • You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
  • You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment
  • Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it



Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 

Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$70,000 - CAD$97,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Economics
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

Chainlink Labs is pioneering the world’s first fully sustainable and decentralized oracle network, and the Economics team is searching for a Senior Analyst to play a critical role in building it. This role will sit at the intersection of blockchain technology, financial innovation, and economic systems, and shape the future of decentralized economics.

As a Senior Analyst, you will combine economics, data science, and blockchain expertise to shape incentives, optimize network design, and influence the decision-making of our Economics and Executive Leadership teams. You will design, analyze, and operationalize economic models for production applications. You will collaborate across departments to bring innovative solutions from concept to production, ensuring economic soundness and scalability throughout.

This is a high-impact role, offering visibility and influence as you contribute to the development of the Chainlink network. If you’re a meticulous, creative, and motivated individual ready to solve complex economic problems through data-driven decisions in the rapidly evolving world of Web3, this is the role for you.

Your Impact


You'll serve two primary functions: (1) designing and performing analyses that help the Economics and Executive Leadership teams make informed, data-driven decisions, and (2) building and maintaining systems for the parameterization of production applications.
You'll work on a wide array of blockchain economics projects, analyses, and systems, including:
Designing novel mechanisms and incentive schemes
Building models and simulations to evaluate investment opportunities
Designing and parameterizing trading systems
Optimizing parameters for production applications
Contributing to the design of Economics programs and applications
You'll optimize network incentives and systems by engaging directly with the Economics, Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science teams to understand network dynamics at the deepest level.
You'll operationalize processes and analytics systems, and coordinate cross-functionally to implement them.
This is both a highly technical and highly social role. You will have high visibility and a large impact on how Chainlink builds the world’s first fully sustainable decentralized oracle network.

Requirements


5+ years experience in a quantitative role, particularly trading or quant research
A deep understanding of financial and crypto markets and incentives
Extensive financial modeling background, including data engineering and model automation
Strong SQL and Python skills are mandatory
Experience solving economic problems through statistical/econometric analyses
Substantial data analysis and/or data science experience
Meticulous attention to detail.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong Economics and/or Finance background through Masters-level academics and/or multiple years of industry experience.
Strong organizational and coordination skills necessary to productionize/operationalize processes and applications.
Preferably smart contract programming experience (Rust, Go, Solidity), but familiarity with smart contract code and dApp architecture at a minimum
Published research with an economics or crypto focus (e.g., papers on MEV or PBS, staking and slashing dynamics, node compensation, tokenomics, etc.)


All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

Title: Excel Report Developer
Description:
Job Description:

On behalf of our public sector client, Affinity is looking for an Excel Report Developer to build a custom project portfolio and resource capacity template with a dashboard capability that will provide a comprehensive portfolio view across multiple work streams. The goal is to effectively manage and visualize our project budget and resource capacity in a single interactive tool.




Responsibilities:

• Project portfolio overview - A structured table that captures all projects across different work streams, including Project name, status, start-end dates, dependencies, milestones, etc.

• Budget tracking - A financial track can component that shows you know what our actuals are, or total budget allocations spending trends, etc.

• Resource capacity planning - A resource allocation tracker that provides visibility into teams, capacity, utilization availability, forecasting capability to assess staffing needs, and resource distribution across multiple projects.

• Dashboard capabilities:

o Portfolio wide visualization of project status, financials resource distribution

o Automated data visualizations, brackets charts graphs tables for quick insights

o Interactive filtering to drill down by project, work streams, timeframe, or budget categories

o Dynamic calculations to support capacity planning and financial forecasting

Affinity Earn:

Know someone who’s great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/

About Affinity:

Affinity Group is a technology and business consulting and services company. We believe in creating long term relationships between clients and consultants that foster a mutually beneficial partnership. Affinity is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

For more information on Affinity, please visit www.affinity-group.ca

Job Number: 11728

Title: Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst (15 month contract)
Description:
As an integral part of BCMEA’s Data Analytics program, the Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst designs and delivers robust reporting and analytical solutions to drive BCMEA’s ongoing evolution towards a data-driven decision-making culture. This role harnesses data analysis techniques support a centralized IT service desk, and collaborates with diverse stakeholders to continue the develop the maturity of BCMEA’s Data Governance Program. This position is a 15 month contract, and a dedicated resource to the WaterfrontWorks initiative, which is a 7-element technology program focused on improving our workforce planning tools.




Responsibilities

Service Desk: Respond to requests for data pulls, analyses, report distribution changes, new dashboards, etc. including coordination with business or IT teams as necessary.
Optimize Reporting Data: Collaborate with stakeholders to draft changes to BI reports, incorporating insights from data discovery to enhance reporting formats.
Prototyping: Prototype and perform tasks for BI enhancements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and data architecture standards.
Data Analysis Optimization: Facilitate the handover of analyzed data to data scientists for further modeling and to data engineers for pipeline development and implementation.
Utilization of Tools: Utilize Power BI and SQL skills for developing and troubleshooting BI solutions, including DAX creation, query optimization, and semantic model building, to support actionable insights.
Liaise and Coordinate: Liaise with team members and stakeholders to understand analytical solution requirements, including assessing inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs.
Data Governance: Primary support for the Data Governance Program lead. Influence the Data Governance Roadmap in alignment with the needs of the BCMEA and its customers, and lead the implementation of related tools and software.
Reporting and Dashboarding: Develop reports and dashboards using data visualization best practices and organizational report templates, ensuring usability and standardization while meeting Data Analytics program standards.
Designing: Design, maintain, and optimize analytics products, data models, dashboards, and reports using business intelligence tools such as Power BI, and Power BI Report Builder.
Innovation and Improvement: Continuously explore opportunities to enhance data collection and reporting processes to efficiently fulfill stakeholder needs.
Monitor and Review: Regularly review report and dashboard usage metrics, proactively engaging with users to address low usage issues and make necessary adjustments.
Data Accuracy: Conduct data quality validation and assurance audits to uphold ongoing data completeness and accuracy.
Data Enablement: Deliver relevant insights promptly to support informed decision-making and address ad hoc requests effectively.
Data Translation: Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
Industry Trends and Advancements: Stay updated with the latest tools, techniques, and trends in data analytics and business intelligence through continuous learning and skill development.




Qualifications

3 to 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and Data Governance with a Bachelors degree, diploma or certificate in any related field.
Technically proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel & PowerPoint), BI Tools (Power BI & Power BI Report Builder) for data visualization and storytelling, and Data Tools (SQL & Python is a bonus).
Proven work experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing complex information, like report requirements, using multiple data sources and systems.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate and present to diverse audiences.
Versed understanding of data governance principles (e.g., data quality, data literacy, and data security).
You are organized, solutions-driven and passionate about data.
Collaborate effectively in a team environment by fostering open communication and idea-sharing and engaging with various stakeholders effectively.
Critical thinking and analytical abilities to support decision-making processes, interpret data insights and drive actionable recommendations.
You can effectively evaluate situations and propose innovative solutions when necessary. 
Change management certification looked upon favourably




About Us

The British Columbia Maritime Employers Association (BCMEA) represents 49 member companies which consists of ship owners, bulk operators, stevedores, general cargo and containers, and the more than 8,500 employees who work for them. We are integral to Canada’s Pacific Gateway Strategy that links Canada to the rest of the world. This gateway contributes $12 billion dollars and 130,000 direct and indirect jobs to Canada’s economy.

Our head office is located in up and coming Railtown. Close to transit and just minutes away from Gastown and Chinatown. Free parking is available in our designated lot to those who drive. Our office features beautiful exposed brick and modern workstations in an open environment.

BC Maritime Employers Association is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Title: Senior Data and Business Analyst
Description:
Location: Richmond, BC, Canada

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Senior Data and Business Analyst to lead data-driven initiatives and drive strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate will leverage their expertise in data analytics, business processes, and visualization tools to uncover insights, solve complex business challenges, and deliver impactful BI solutions. This position is hybrid, working onsite 3 days per week from Tuesdays through Thursdays.

Responsibilities



Advanced Data Analysis and Visualization:
Extract, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to identify trends and deliver actionable insights.
Maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Qlik, and other analytics platforms.
Present data visualizations that effectively communicate key insights and trends to stakeholders.
Collaborate with leadership to understand strategic objectives and align data analytics initiatives accordingly.
Business Analysis and Strategy:
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Analyze business processes and recommend improvements to optimize operational performance.
Identify deficiencies in business/data processes, data quality, usability or accuracy.
Perform impact analysis and “what if” assessments for systems enhancements.
Document all systems-related processes and flows.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data solutions.
Project Management:
Utilize Jira/Aha to manage tasks, track project progress, and prioritize deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of data projects.
Lead data-focused workshops, meetings, and presentations to drive alignment across teams.
Data Governance and Quality Assurance:
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across systems.
Develop and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
Designing processes and proactively addressing data quality issues and improving reporting reliability.
Coordinates and conducts User Acceptance Testing.
Continuous Improvement and Innovation:
Stay at the forefront of industry trends, technologies, and advancements in data analytics.
Propose and implement innovative solutions, methodologies, and tools to enhance the organization's data capabilities.


Minimum Qualifications



Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data and business analysis.
Expertise in Power BI and Qlik for data visualization and reporting.
Extensive expertise in Excel and other data analysis tools for processing and analyzing large datasets.
Familiarity with JIRA and AHA for workflow and project management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (e.g., Salesforce, AWS and SAP).
Knowledge of Agile or Scrum methodologies.


Career Growth Philosophy

At Semtech, we seek innovation and leadership from each and every member of our team. Our goal is to ensure that our talented professionals are equipped with support, resources, and the opportunity to excel. Our pay-for-performance philosophy provides recognition and prestige coupled with a competitive compensation package.

The intent of this job description is to describe the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. Incumbents may be required to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically included in this description.

All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

A reasonable estimate of the pay range for this position is CAD $75,000 - $95,000. There are several factors taken into consideration in determining base salary, including but not limited to: job-related qualifications, skills, education and experience, as well as job location and the value of other elements of an employee’s total compensation package.

Our goal is to ensure that our talented professionals are equipped with support, resources, and the opportunity to excel. Our pay-for-performance philosophy provides recognition and prestige coupled with a competitive compensation package.

The intent of this job description is to describe the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. Incumbents may be required to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically included in this description.

All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

A reasonable estimate of the pay range for this position is CAD $75,000 - $95,000. There are several factors taken into consideration in determining base salary, including but not limited to: job-related qualifications, skills, education and experience, as well as job location and the value of other elements of an employee’s total compensation package.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job description:

We seek a skilled and experienced data engineer to build data pipelines for data-driven plastic recycling. A successful candidate will join our dynamic team to design and develop pipelines for data gathering and analytics in recycling. An ideal candidate will have a strong data engineering/infrastructure knowledge, experience in machine learning and a software background. Chemical and process engineering knowledge, familiarity with IOTs, transformer-based architectures are a plus.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and processing using Python and SQL on local terminals and AWS. Enforce data hygiene to ensure accuracy.
Improve upon existing analytical data processing pipelines and machine learning algorithms.
Fine-tune and deploy transformer-based architectures to make process recommendations.
Collaborate across teams to develop and integrate data solutions into recycling lines. Report and present the state of the data pipelines and gathering capabilities.
Develop data acquisition pipelines for edge devices (e.g., sensors.) Ensure communication between edge devices and central systems using well-established protocols.
Develop and debug software for Windows platforms using C++, C#, or scripting languages




Candidate Requirements:

2+ years of experience in data engineering, software engineering, or machine learning.
Experience in Python, SQL, PyTorch, Windows Programming, and edge-device SDKs.
Understanding of cloud computing platforms and machine-learning development.
Track record of building and shipping high-quality work and achieving high reliability.
Experience with prototyping for a local real-time application.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and critical thinking.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Background in chemical engineering and materials processing is a plus

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Design and build visually impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI and Tableau.
Migrate and integrate legacy Tableau systems into Power BI, ensuring consistency and usability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Technical Data Analyst, Blockchain
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to drive the development of Chainlink’s public-facing dashboard. This dashboard will serve as a key resource for the Web3 community, showcasing metrics that highlight the performance, adoption, and impact of the Chainlink Network. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in data engineering combined with a deep understanding of the blockchain and Web3 space.

In this role, you will take ownership of defining the metrics to be displayed, building the logic to calculate these metrics, and creating robust data pipelines to ensure their delivery. You’ll be responsible for the accuracy, quality, and timeliness of these metrics, while also contributing insights into how these metrics should reflect the unique aspects of the blockchain ecosystem.

Your Impact


Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize metrics for the dashboard.
Build logic to calculate metrics such as transaction volume, total value secured, and staking activity.
Design and maintain ETL pipelines to process blockchain data and ensure seamless delivery to the dashboard.
Ensure high data quality and timeliness through monitoring, validation, and debugging processes.
Provide insights into blockchain-specific metrics, differentiating between concepts such as transaction volume vs. locked value and understanding diverse protocol types (e.g., perpetuals vs. lending protocols).
Act as a subject matter expert in blockchain data, helping teams interpret the difference between decentralized applications (Dapps) and smart contracts. Partnering with GTM and Marketing which makes understanding metrics and blockchain is important.


Requirements


Proven experience in data engineering, with expertise in ETL processes, cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS), and tools like Apache Airflow, SQL, and Python.
Strong knowledge of blockchain fundamentals, including smart contracts, decentralized applications, and protocol types.
Familiarity with Web3 metrics, such as transaction volume, TVL (Total Value Locked), staking, and protocol usage data.
Excellent ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams, including data science, product, and engineering.
Passion for Web3, blockchain, and decentralized ecosystems.


Join our team to craft the data backbone of Chainlink’s public narrative, providing the Web3 community with the insights they need to understand and trust the value of decentralized systems!

All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
