Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

Axiom Builders is a leading construction partner for many major developers in both residential and commercial construction, with over 5 million square feet under construction in Vancouver, Victoria, Calgary , Seattle and Nashville . Our skilled team of over 500 diverse construction professionals are dedicated to meeting client expectations, with the goal of becoming an extension of their project team. Together, we execute thoughtful community-centric projects, always with safety top of mind and backed by our COR safety certification.

From iconic residential towers, noteworthy rental developments, LEED Gold office buildings, and purpose-built tenant improvements, our portfolio and expertise continue to grow. Two of our projects – Fifteen Fifteen in Vancouver and REN in Seattle – received a 2023 Award of Excellence from the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat (CTBUH). We’re also proud to have representation on the UDI U40 Executive Committee, and to have made Kincentric’s Best Employers list a few times over the past few years.

Our expertise , determination and straightforward approach are derived from our values – Accountability, Autonomy, Excellence, Humility, and Respect. The result: a quality product that’s built right – the first time.

Learn more about life at Axiom and our projects .

About The Role

Axiom Builders is seeking a Data Engineer to support the development, implementation, and maintenance of our data infrastructure at our head office in Vancouver. Working with cross-functional stakeholders to understand and address data requirements, the Data Engineer will take ownership of the end-to-end data engineering components, develop data pipelines to collect, store and transform data effectively and accurately, while maintaining data engineering and architecture best practices.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Microsoft Fabric;
Implement medallion data architecture that supports batch data processing;
Integrate various data sources into a unified data model, leveraging Microsoft Fabric for storage and analytics;
Create and maintain ETL/ELT processes to load, transform, and cleanse data efficiently;
Build and maintain optimized, scalable data models for Power BI and other analytics tools and maintain comprehensive documentation for data pipelines, models, and workflows;
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective data solutions;
Enable advanced analytics and reporting by developing reusable data sets and semantic layers;
Optimize storage, compute, and data access strategies to balance performance and cost, focusing on Microsoft Fabric capabilities.
Provide support and guidance to team members or cross-functional teams using Microsoft tools.


What You Bring

The ideal candidate is a first-rate problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced environment where autonomy is encouraged. You are detail-oriented, analytical, and you possess exceptional customer service and communication skills. Most importantly, you take great pride and ownership in your work, and you want to be part of a team that embraces new technology and innovation.

Skills And Experience


Diploma or degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field;
3+ years of professional experience in Data Engineering;
Strong expertise in Microsoft data technology stack including Azure Data Factory, ADLS Gen 2, Azure SQL, Azure Key Vault and Power BI;
Strong expertise implementing medallion architectures (experience with Microsoft Fabric is an asset);
Strong expertise in programming PySpark and SQL;
Experience in Microsoft Power BI, Power Query and other Power Platform tools;
Analytical mindset with the ability to problem-solve and troubleshoot to resolve complex data-related issues;
Clear and effective communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders;
Experience in Construction industry or similar industries is considered an asset;
Excited to support the growth of data within an organization.


Your Rewards

We’re committed to the success and development of our people and recognize that they are the drivers behind our success. We provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

The base salary range for this role is posted below , depending on experience, plus a competitive bonus program. During the interview process, let’s t alk to get the right fit for your experience level.

In Addition, Our Total Rewards Package Offers

Rewards


Benefits & Perks | 100% health/dental coverage,* up to 5% match on retirement savings, virtual healthcare, and great perks
Mental Health Support  | Unlimited counselling and support for you and your family
Compensation | Competitive pay with annual market analysis


Opportunities


Unique Projects | 40+ projects in motion, from skyline-changers to bespoke sales centres
Career Growth | Twice per year we level-up with our Performance Feedback Program
Learning & Development | 15 offerings from our dedicated L&D team


Community


The People | Annual events to bring us together and connect across markets and teams
Giving Back | 2000 + volunteer hours since launch of our Community Engagement program
Leadership | 12 passionate execs focused on developing our teams and emerging leaders


What’s Next: How to Apply

About

Want to love what you do? We’re always looking for talented people who fit our culture and are passionate about what they do. Here are t wo easy ways to apply:


Click ‘A pply Now ’
Email careers@axiombuilders.ca


Thank you for your interest in Axiom Builders! While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file for future opportunities.

Follow us on LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.


For Canadian employees. Our US benefits package is equally competitive.


Apply Now

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:


In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.



Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!


TELUS Digital AI Community


Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.


Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.



Basic Requirements


Full Professional Proficiency in English language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada.

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software



Assessment


In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.



Equal Opportunity


  • All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Insight Global is looking to hire a Data Engineer for a retail client based in Vancouver. This role is a hybrid position and requires 3 days onsite/week in Downtown Vancouver. You will be joining a team that works heavily with customer data - owning the customer data pipelines that gather data coming from multiple sources and consolidating that data for different use cases. The team has completed the implementation of an analytics tool to gather customer data from the web, and they are now tasked with moving the data from the analytics platform to their internal Snowflake platform. The ideal candidate will possess experience migrating data from a Google stack of GCP/BigQuery to an Azure/Snowflake environment. The successful candidate will be contributing to all areas of development, and operations and participate in day-to-day production releases and on-call support functions as needed. Additional projects include:

Creation and maintenance od data pipelines (GCP, Azure Cloud, Azure Databricks, Snowflake)
Creation of secure data views and publish them to the Enterprise Data Exchange via Snowflake
Modernization and migration of data pipelines using Databricks Delta Tables (DLT) and Unity Catalog
Analysis of Adobe Analytics GA4 analytics data




Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience with database engineering – building out and deploying data pipelines, ideally working with customer data
Experience with Google Analytics (version 4) or Adobe Analytics or any other analytics platform
3+ years of experience working with Azure applications (Azure Data Factory, Azure Batch, Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Warehouse, Azure Databricks, etc.) and building out Azure pipelines
2+ years of experience working with Azure Databricks
Experience with GCP and BigQuery
Strong scripting experience with Python & SQL
Experience working in an Agile environment
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal




Plusses:

Retail and/or e-commerce experience; experience working for a multi-channel retailer
Experience with Snowflake or any enterprise data warehouse

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy ⚡️

We’re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion.

If changing the world wasn’t incentive enough, here’s why you should join us:

We designed, built, and operated the world’s leading stellarators.

We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.

We know what we’re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.

We’ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.

Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.

Company: Type One Energy Group - Canada, Inc.

Job Title: Project Analyst

NOC: 11201 – Professional occupations in business management consulting

Offered Wage: $43.00 – 45.00/hour (based on a 40-hour workweek) - permanent/full-time

Work Location: 1140 West Pender St., Vancouver, BC V6E 4G1 Canada

Number of Positions: One (1)

Required Language Skills: English (spoken & written)

About Us

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. Established in 2019 and venture-backed in 2023, the company is led by a team of globally recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-the-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system.

Our FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and equitable access to clean energy. For more information, visit www.typeoneenergy.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting Type One Energy's mission to revolutionize energy production by managing complex projects within the fusion energy sector. The successful candidate will oversee project schedules, budgets, and risk management, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize project performance. This role requires advanced skills in automation, statistical analysis, and specialized project management tools, with a focus on driving operational efficiency and continuous improvement across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and deliverables for complex, high-stakes projects within the fusion energy sector.
Create and manage risk registers, conduct FMEA risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies using tools like LogicGate and RiskyProject.
Utilize advanced statistical methods and programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, SQL) to analyze project data and optimize key performance metrics. Design custom dashboards in PowerBI for real-time project monitoring.
Automate project processes using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, and custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script/Power Fx). Develop automated systems for documentation, purchasing, and other operational workflows.
Configure and manage project management tools (e.g., Primavera P6, JIRA, Smartsheet) to meet project requirements and enhance team collaboration. Integrate these tools with platforms like Confluence and SharePoint.
Oversee the timecard system tailored to the organization’s needs. Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee work hours, monitor data quality, trouble soot discrepancies, and resolve issue promptly.
Develop and customize reports to meet specific departmental needs or management requests, such as cost tracking, schedule health check
Lead initiatives to improve project management processes, gather team feedback, and implement enhancements based on data analysis.


Required Skills

The successful candidate must have:


A minimum of 2 years of experience in the fusion energy sector or a related high-technology industry, with expertise in managing complex technical projects and understanding project management practices specific to engineering or energy-related fields.
At least 2 years of experience in advanced Excel, with expertise in data management and analysis, complex formulas and calculations, pivot tables and charts, data automation and Validation.
At least 2 years of experience using advanced project management software, including Primavera P6, JIRA, LogicGate, and Smartsheet, with demonstrated capability in configuring these tools to meet project requirements.
At least 2 years of experience in automating workflows using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, or custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script).
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis using programming languages like Python, MATLAB, or SQL, with proficiency in creating data visualization dashboards using PowerBI.
At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.


Required Education


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Data Science, or a related field.


Benefits


Bonus (if applicable):
Disability Insurance
Dental Insurance
RRSP with up to 4% company match
Extended Medical Insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
Vacation Days – 12 Holidays & 15 Days PTO
Any additional benefits offered:
Company Shares

How To Apply

Please send your resume to the following email address: careers@typeoneenergy.com. We ask that the candidates put "Project Analyst" in the email subject line when they apply so that it's easily identifiable. We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. The company was formed in 2019 by a team of globally-recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies.

Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system. Its FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy.

For more information, visit https://www.typeoneenergy.com/.

  • At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Vancouver, BC (in-office)

Salary Range: $65,000 - $90,000 /yr.

The commercial software division within Intellifi is the leading provider of mortgage valuation and software for the commercial real estate finance industry in Canada. Our clients include some of Canada’s most prominent financial institutions, investment managers and pension funds. We are seeking an experienced technology professional with excellent communication skills to join our team as an Analytics Engineer. The ideal engineer has experience working with large data sets, using MS Fabric and Power BI Service, and a solid understanding of Azure SQL databases and data modelling concepts. If you’re adept at collaborating with stakeholders to translate complex requirements into innovative technology solutions, this role is for you!

Role And Responsibilities


Design and develop end-to-end data solutions using the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem
Implement dimensional modeling (e.g., star/snowflake schemas) to ensure accurate, efficient, and scalable semantic models
Leverage Power Query, DAX, and SQL within Fabric/SSMS for data extraction and transformations
Create and manage data pipelines to ingest data from diverse on-premises and cloud sources, applying best practices for cleansing, transformation, and version control
Monitor and tune performance of queries, pipelines, and data models to ensure reliability and optimal load times
Collaborate with other team members to align solutions with business objectives and user needs
Maintain robust documentation for reporting assets, ensuring ease of maintenance and effective knowledge sharing
Stay current with the latest Fabric features, continuously exploring new tools and methodologies to enhance data visualization and analytics capabilities
Manage timelines and deliverables, effectively communicating progress, and updates to relevant stakeholders


Required Skills And Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field; equivalent experience also considered
Experience with core Fabric components (Power BI reports, Semantic Models, Lake Houses, Data Warehouses, Dataflow Gen2) and their use cases
Solid understanding of dimensional data modeling principles, including star/snowflake schemas
Proven ability to build and optimize reports, and datasets using DAX, Power Query, and related best practices
Competency in querying and manipulating data within Azure SQL or similar relational database systems
Experience with Git, DevOps, or equivalent tools to track and manage changes in data assets
Knowledge of implementing data privacy, row-level security, and compliance standards


About Us

Welcome to Intellifi, where our mission is “Lending Solutions Simplified”. This is more than tagline for us – it’s our commitment to every customer, business partner and team member.

While we have decades worth of experience and expertise in Commercial Services and Technology, Residential Services, and Residential Technology, we aren’t standing still. From the adventurous start-ups to the established institutions with billions in assets, and to those we have yet to serve, we owe it to our dozens of clients to always be moving forward.

At Intellifi we believe that a culture of innovation, creativity and partnership is what enable us to provide executable end-to-end solutions to the various lenders in the residential and commercial industry in Canada. Where hi-tech meets hi-touch, we are a team of experts providing a selection of technology products and lending operations services that helps create efficiency in loan management for both our clients and their customers.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Intellifi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process by emailing HR@intellifi.ca.

We want to hear from you!

If you are confident that you would be a strong asset to our team, submit both a cover letter and resume today! We thank all applicants for their time in applying, however we will only contact those selected for an interview. Consideration of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled.

Title: Business Systems Analyst - Marketing Technology (Remote - Canada)
Description:
Summary

Have a passion for automation? Love working on Marketing platforms and processes? Enjoy using your creative ideas and technical knowledge to help catalyze business success? As a remote Marketing Technology Business System Analyst at Yelp, you'll have the opportunity to think creatively about how to make internal tools better, to research and evaluate new innovative solutions, to scale to support Yelp’s fast growth, and to contribute to the success of our marketing teams.

Business Systems Analysts are the drivers for all innovative and transformational projects that impact our marketers’ ability to deliver the right message, to the right customer, at the right time. On an average day, BSAs might be immersed in creating project planning artifacts, contributing to technical solution designs, collaborating with marketing leadership on their strategic goals, documenting user stories, and spec-ing out new ideas, while always improving the Yelper experience.

Our team leads and manages projects from conception through execution, forming the bridge between our business teams, product teams, and technical teams. We get excited about focusing on the business side of technical problems and finding creative solutions. Join a supportive team where you will continue to develop your skills while ensuring that Yelp has an effective and scalable platform for our business-critical departments!

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Manage, design, and improve marketing tools and processes: Oversee the development and enhancement of marketing tools and processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Lead projects from conception to execution: Guide projects through all phases, including planning and scoping, research and analysis, functional design, testing, and rollout.
Planning and scoping: Collaborate with business partners to identify and refine project proposals. Develop project scope, timelines, estimates, and detailed work plans.
Analysis and design: Utilize strong analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills to understand business needs, redefine processes, and recommend best practices. Partner with technical teams to design quality, scalable solutions.
Testing and rollout: Ensure successful implementation of new processes and features. Lead change management initiatives and facilitate effective training efforts.
Vendor evaluation: Conduct research on tools, organize vendor demonstrations, and create comprehensive evaluation reports.


What It Takes To Succeed


Ideally 3+ years of business systems analyst experience.
Ideally 3+ years of hands-on, operational experience with Marketing Automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, HubSpot or Iterable.
Clear understanding of the platform's technical capabilities and limitations.
Experience in creating presentations, workflows, roadmaps for effective project planning and requirements communications.
Skilled in driving adoption, facilitating change, and improving business results.
Strong skills in building consensus and effectively coordinating and managing projects across multiple business units and technical teams.
Exposure to and understanding of the salesforce.com platform


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $85,000-166,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice


Show more

  • Vendor evaluation: Conduct research on tools, organize vendor demonstrations, and create comprehensive evaluation reports.

What It Takes To Succeed

  • Ideally 3+ years of business systems analyst experience.
  • Ideally 3+ years of hands-on, operational experience with Marketing Automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, HubSpot or Iterable.
  • Clear understanding of the platform's technical capabilities and limitations.
  • Experience in creating presentations, workflows, roadmaps for effective project planning and requirements communications.
  • Skilled in driving adoption, facilitating change, and improving business results.
  • Strong skills in building consensus and effectively coordinating and managing projects across multiple business units and technical teams.
  • Exposure to and understanding of the salesforce.com platform

What You'll Get

  • Compensation range is $85,000-166,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
  • This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
  • You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!

Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Business Systems Support Analyst
Description:
Home to vast parkland and attractions including Grouse Mountain, Lynn Canyon and Capilano Suspension Bridge, the District of North Vancouver is inspired by nature, and enriched by people. Designated one of BC’s Top Employers for six years, the District offers exciting professional development opportunities and a competitive total compensation package including a nine day fortnight. Known for being a flexible, family-friendly employer with an inclusive workplace culture, the District of North Vancouver is an exceptional place to work. If you are civic-minded and interested in making an impact on people and businesses on the beautiful North Shore, consider working for the District of North Vancouver.




We’re working to modernize and enhance our building and development application process to make it more efficient, flexible, and easier to navigate, and need a curious, creative, and innovative Business Systems Support Analyst to join the small but mighty team working to bring our vision to life.




What we can offer you

Working within the District’s Digital Services team, and collaborating closely with our Planning, Properties, and Permits department plus key stakeholders from across the organization, you’ll support efforts to implement the findings from a comprehensive Development Approval Process Report (DAPR), which identifies a range of ‘quick win’ and longer term initiatives that will make our building and development application process faster, easier, and more user-friendly for the public.




In this role, you’ll act as a business technology analyst, focussed on documenting, analyzing, and improving business processes while considering opportunities to implement, improve, and integrate technology to enhance efficiency and optimize business outcomes.




You’ll assess the challenges faced by both applicants and staff, recommend innovative solutions, and guide the implementation of process and technology improvements.




Your work will directly impact the community by enhancing transparency, efficiency, and accessibility in how we handle building permits, development applications, and related services.




You’ll need a keen interest in process improvement and service design, combined with strong change management skills, as you’ll be tasked with bringing a structured approach to solving complex problems.




Your key responsibilities:

Process analysis and improvement: Evaluate current building and development application processes to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement
Stakeholder collaboration: Engage with staff, applicants, and community stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into actionable requirements
Technology solutions: Assess, recommend, and implement digital tools and systems to support a seamless application process, ensuring compliance with privacy, IT, and purchasing standards
Future-state design: Collaborate with teams to design and document optimized workflows, policies, and procedures for the application process
Change management: Support change management efforts, including stakeholder communication, training, and monitoring progress to ensure successful adoption of new solutions
Data-driven decision making: Leverage tools like Power BI to analyze trends, monitor performance, and support continuous improvement of services
Vendor coordination: Work with technology providers to evaluate and implement solutions tailored to the District’s needs while balancing technical, business, and policy considerations




What you’ll need to succeed

As per the Business Systems Support Analyst class specification, you need:
A natural curiosity coupled with an analytical way of thinking and the ability to explain difficult concepts to nontechnical users at all levels of the organization
An ability to work in a blended team of onsite and remote team members, in a fast-paced environment
A high level of initiative, creativity, and flexibility
The ability to analyze and evaluate requirements to develop logical solutions for problems
Very strong collaboration, communication, and facilitation skills




Qualifications

Completion of a 2-year diploma program in computer systems technology from a recognized institute of technology, plus considerable related experience including some system design and analysis experience, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.




Details

Salary: The pay range for this unionized position is $46.07 to $54.44 per hour (2024 rates)

Hours of Work: 35-hour work week (Compressed work schedule available)




Apply

The District of North Vancouver is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and accessible work environment. If you have what we’re looking for and have a passion to serve people and the community, a demonstrated understanding of safety, a commitment to supporting a healthy and safe workplace, and a willingness to take further safety training as required, we would like to hear from you. Please apply with on-line at https://careers.dnv.org by February 11, 2025 to be considered.




If you require accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us when we contact you.




We thank you for your interest in employment with the District of North Vancouver and advise that only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.




We respectfully acknowledge the Coast Salish peoples, specifically the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh Úxwumixw (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh), on whose ancestral lands the District of North Vancouver is located.




Show more

Title: Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning
Description:
Department: Supply Planning

Reports to: Director, Supply Planning

Your opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

The Digital Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning works with cross-functional teams to analyze data, monitor performance metrics, and provide valuable insights to enhance overall supply planning performance. You will contribute to the achievement of KPI goals, identify areas for improvement, and support data-driven decision-making across various departments.

 

This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid or remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

 

Meet your future team:

The Supply Planning team is dynamic group of high-level planners who are responsible for the development and on-time delivery of the supply plan to warehouse.  Our planners partner with internal and external teams to identify and mitigate supply risks, manage production readiness, prioritize business requirements, and reconcile gaps in delivery.




If you were in this position now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Gathering business questions and translating them into data requirements and specifications
Extracting and analyzing data from various platforms, such as SAP, AFO, and other data collection platforms
Monitoring and analyzing supply chain data performance to KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement and risks in on time delivery
Preparing regular reports and dashboards summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations for stakeholders and management to inform decision-making processes
Developing and maintaining documentation of analyses and insights to continuously build and develop data analysis process across supply planning
Monitoring and reporting on outcomes of improvements and progress against performance goals
Conducting ad hoc analysis, as required, for cross-functional partners to drive end to end Supply Chain on time delivery
Supporting training of colleagues and internal partners in their use of digital analytics to answer their business questions and develop standardized analytics processes
Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and integrity across systems and analysis data points




Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Evaluating data-related process gaps across the Supply Planning and cross-functional departments, summarizing and proposing recommendations to Supply leaders for continuous process evolution
Contributing to the evolution of data tools across the business, providing subject matter expertise in future development of data platforms




Are you our next Data Analytics Specialist, Supply Planning?
You have 4+ years of experience as a Digital Analyst or similar role, preferably within supply chain
You have a University degree in Math, Economic, Statistics, Finance, Business or equivalent
You have strong analytical skills with a proven track record of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets
You have an understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness
You have strong expertise in SAP systems, particularly SAP Retail, SAP ERP, and SAP Master Data Governance (MDG).
High proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
You have an extreme attention to detail and an ability to dig into large amounts of data and find the inconsistencies and risks
You have strong communication and business presentation skills, ability to effectively communicate to all levels of stakeholders
Familiarity with retail operations, including product management, pricing, and supply chain processes, is highly desirable.
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it







Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 

Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$70,000 - CAD$97,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

Title: Data Analyst, Cloud Control Engineering
Description:
Back to search results

Previous job Next job

Job Summary

Job Description

The Opportunity

Join an innovative team as a Data Analyst in the Cloud Control Engineering team at RBC. In this role, you will be an integral part of managing and building our program KRIs. We are looking for a passionate and creative Data Analyst who is excited about problem-solving and working with the latest technologies.

As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with Risk, SREs, Platform Engineers, Architects, and Security Professionals. Your contributions will be vital in maintaining and enhancing our program's compliance across an agile framework. Additionally, you will participate in a support on-call rotation, demonstrating flexibility and dedication to our 24/7 operational needs.

What will you do?


Analyze structured and unstructured data using statistical techniques and create dashboards & reports in visualization tools
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data streams
Manage and support the development and implementation of Key Risk Indicators (KRI) & Metric processes for the cloud program
Collaborate with technical teams to keep key metrics and KRIs in green
Guide technical teams, provide education and thought leadership
Utilize the latest technologies available, design, and build data solutions to meet business needs
Take ownership and have ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to drive work to completion under restrictive timelines. Has creativity, energy, and passion for leveraging technology to transform our industry; the belief that automation is the only way and the ability to talk for hours as to why.
Thrive on challenges and have a proven ability to set ambitious but achievable goals and surpass them.
At RBC, we work together. You will be the type of person that brings that approach to your work. You will have a proven ability to build, grow, and maintain relationships both internally and externally.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


A relevant degree or certificate in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or a comparable field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience using tools like Splunk, ELK, Tableau to visualize and report data.
Experience in coding with a variety of languages like Python, Scala, or Java.
Experience with relational databases and NoSQL data stores.
Experience with scheduling tools, such as Air Flow.


Nice To Have


Experience with control frameworks (e.g., CSA, NIST, Custom) and/or Regulatory Audits.
Experience working in a large enterprise organization and/or Financial Sector Institution.
An understanding of cloud and experience working with cloud technologies


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Economics
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

Chainlink Labs is pioneering the world’s first fully sustainable and decentralized oracle network, and the Economics team is searching for a Senior Analyst to play a critical role in building it. This role will sit at the intersection of blockchain technology, financial innovation, and economic systems, and shape the future of decentralized economics.

As a Senior Analyst, you will combine economics, data science, and blockchain expertise to shape incentives, optimize network design, and influence the decision-making of our Economics and Executive Leadership teams. You will design, analyze, and operationalize economic models for production applications. You will collaborate across departments to bring innovative solutions from concept to production, ensuring economic soundness and scalability throughout.

This is a high-impact role, offering visibility and influence as you contribute to the development of the Chainlink network. If you’re a meticulous, creative, and motivated individual ready to solve complex economic problems through data-driven decisions in the rapidly evolving world of Web3, this is the role for you.

Your Impact


You'll serve two primary functions: (1) designing and performing analyses that help the Economics and Executive Leadership teams make informed, data-driven decisions, and (2) building and maintaining systems for the parameterization of production applications.
You'll work on a wide array of blockchain economics projects, analyses, and systems, including:
Designing novel mechanisms and incentive schemes
Building models and simulations to evaluate investment opportunities
Designing and parameterizing trading systems
Optimizing parameters for production applications
Contributing to the design of Economics programs and applications
You'll optimize network incentives and systems by engaging directly with the Economics, Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science teams to understand network dynamics at the deepest level.
You'll operationalize processes and analytics systems, and coordinate cross-functionally to implement them.
This is both a highly technical and highly social role. You will have high visibility and a large impact on how Chainlink builds the world’s first fully sustainable decentralized oracle network.

Requirements


5+ years experience in a quantitative role, particularly trading or quant research
A deep understanding of financial and crypto markets and incentives
Extensive financial modeling background, including data engineering and model automation
Strong SQL and Python skills are mandatory
Experience solving economic problems through statistical/econometric analyses
Substantial data analysis and/or data science experience
Meticulous attention to detail.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong Economics and/or Finance background through Masters-level academics and/or multiple years of industry experience.
Strong organizational and coordination skills necessary to productionize/operationalize processes and applications.
Preferably smart contract programming experience (Rust, Go, Solidity), but familiarity with smart contract code and dApp architecture at a minimum
Published research with an economics or crypto focus (e.g., papers on MEV or PBS, staking and slashing dynamics, node compensation, tokenomics, etc.)


All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
Show more
HTML:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

Chainlink Labs is pioneering the world’s first fully sustainable and decentralized oracle network, and the Economics team is searching for a Senior Analyst to play a critical role in building it. This role will sit at the intersection of blockchain technology, financial innovation, and economic systems, and shape the future of decentralized economics.

As a Senior Analyst, you will combine economics, data science, and blockchain expertise to shape incentives, optimize network design, and influence the decision-making of our Economics and Executive Leadership teams. You will design, analyze, and operationalize economic models for production applications. You will collaborate across departments to bring innovative solutions from concept to production, ensuring economic soundness and scalability throughout.

This is a high-impact role, offering visibility and influence as you contribute to the development of the Chainlink network. If you’re a meticulous, creative, and motivated individual ready to solve complex economic problems through data-driven decisions in the rapidly evolving world of Web3, this is the role for you.

Your Impact

  • You'll serve two primary functions: (1) designing and performing analyses that help the Economics and Executive Leadership teams make informed, data-driven decisions, and (2) building and maintaining systems for the parameterization of production applications.
  • You'll work on a wide array of blockchain economics projects, analyses, and systems, including:
    • Designing novel mechanisms and incentive schemes
    • Building models and simulations to evaluate investment opportunities
    • Designing and parameterizing trading systems
    • Optimizing parameters for production applications
    • Contributing to the design of Economics programs and applications
  • You'll optimize network incentives and systems by engaging directly with the Economics, Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science teams to understand network dynamics at the deepest level.
  • You'll operationalize processes and analytics systems, and coordinate cross-functionally to implement them.
  • This is both a highly technical and highly social role. You will have high visibility and a large impact on how Chainlink builds the world’s first fully sustainable decentralized oracle network.
Requirements

  • 5+ years experience in a quantitative role, particularly trading or quant research
  • A deep understanding of financial and crypto markets and incentives
  • Extensive financial modeling background, including data engineering and model automation
  • Strong SQL and Python skills are mandatory
  • Experience solving economic problems through statistical/econometric analyses
  • Substantial data analysis and/or data science experience
  • Meticulous attention to detail.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong Economics and/or Finance background through Masters-level academics and/or multiple years of industry experience.
  • Strong organizational and coordination skills necessary to productionize/operationalize processes and applications.
  • Preferably smart contract programming experience (Rust, Go, Solidity), but familiarity with smart contract code and dApp architecture at a minimum
  • Published research with an economics or crypto focus (e.g., papers on MEV or PBS, staking and slashing dynamics, node compensation, tokenomics, etc.)

All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

Title: Excel Report Developer
Description:
Job Description:

On behalf of our public sector client, Affinity is looking for an Excel Report Developer to build a custom project portfolio and resource capacity template with a dashboard capability that will provide a comprehensive portfolio view across multiple work streams. The goal is to effectively manage and visualize our project budget and resource capacity in a single interactive tool.




Responsibilities:

• Project portfolio overview - A structured table that captures all projects across different work streams, including Project name, status, start-end dates, dependencies, milestones, etc.

• Budget tracking - A financial track can component that shows you know what our actuals are, or total budget allocations spending trends, etc.

• Resource capacity planning - A resource allocation tracker that provides visibility into teams, capacity, utilization availability, forecasting capability to assess staffing needs, and resource distribution across multiple projects.

• Dashboard capabilities:

o Portfolio wide visualization of project status, financials resource distribution

o Automated data visualizations, brackets charts graphs tables for quick insights

o Interactive filtering to drill down by project, work streams, timeframe, or budget categories

o Dynamic calculations to support capacity planning and financial forecasting

Affinity Earn:

Know someone who’s great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/

About Affinity:

Affinity Group is a technology and business consulting and services company. We believe in creating long term relationships between clients and consultants that foster a mutually beneficial partnership. Affinity is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

For more information on Affinity, please visit www.affinity-group.ca

Title: Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst (15 month contract)
Description:
As an integral part of BCMEA’s Data Analytics program, the Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst designs and delivers robust reporting and analytical solutions to drive BCMEA’s ongoing evolution towards a data-driven decision-making culture. This role harnesses data analysis techniques support a centralized IT service desk, and collaborates with diverse stakeholders to continue the develop the maturity of BCMEA’s Data Governance Program. This position is a 15 month contract, and a dedicated resource to the WaterfrontWorks initiative, which is a 7-element technology program focused on improving our workforce planning tools.




Responsibilities

Service Desk: Respond to requests for data pulls, analyses, report distribution changes, new dashboards, etc. including coordination with business or IT teams as necessary.
Optimize Reporting Data: Collaborate with stakeholders to draft changes to BI reports, incorporating insights from data discovery to enhance reporting formats.
Prototyping: Prototype and perform tasks for BI enhancements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and data architecture standards.
Data Analysis Optimization: Facilitate the handover of analyzed data to data scientists for further modeling and to data engineers for pipeline development and implementation.
Utilization of Tools: Utilize Power BI and SQL skills for developing and troubleshooting BI solutions, including DAX creation, query optimization, and semantic model building, to support actionable insights.
Liaise and Coordinate: Liaise with team members and stakeholders to understand analytical solution requirements, including assessing inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs.
Data Governance: Primary support for the Data Governance Program lead. Influence the Data Governance Roadmap in alignment with the needs of the BCMEA and its customers, and lead the implementation of related tools and software.
Reporting and Dashboarding: Develop reports and dashboards using data visualization best practices and organizational report templates, ensuring usability and standardization while meeting Data Analytics program standards.
Designing: Design, maintain, and optimize analytics products, data models, dashboards, and reports using business intelligence tools such as Power BI, and Power BI Report Builder.
Innovation and Improvement: Continuously explore opportunities to enhance data collection and reporting processes to efficiently fulfill stakeholder needs.
Monitor and Review: Regularly review report and dashboard usage metrics, proactively engaging with users to address low usage issues and make necessary adjustments.
Data Accuracy: Conduct data quality validation and assurance audits to uphold ongoing data completeness and accuracy.
Data Enablement: Deliver relevant insights promptly to support informed decision-making and address ad hoc requests effectively.
Data Translation: Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
Industry Trends and Advancements: Stay updated with the latest tools, techniques, and trends in data analytics and business intelligence through continuous learning and skill development.




Qualifications

3 to 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and Data Governance with a Bachelors degree, diploma or certificate in any related field.
Technically proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel & PowerPoint), BI Tools (Power BI & Power BI Report Builder) for data visualization and storytelling, and Data Tools (SQL & Python is a bonus).
Proven work experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing complex information, like report requirements, using multiple data sources and systems.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate and present to diverse audiences.
Versed understanding of data governance principles (e.g., data quality, data literacy, and data security).
You are organized, solutions-driven and passionate about data.
Collaborate effectively in a team environment by fostering open communication and idea-sharing and engaging with various stakeholders effectively.
Critical thinking and analytical abilities to support decision-making processes, interpret data insights and drive actionable recommendations.
You can effectively evaluate situations and propose innovative solutions when necessary. 
Change management certification looked upon favourably




About Us

The British Columbia Maritime Employers Association (BCMEA) represents 49 member companies which consists of ship owners, bulk operators, stevedores, general cargo and containers, and the more than 8,500 employees who work for them. We are integral to Canada’s Pacific Gateway Strategy that links Canada to the rest of the world. This gateway contributes $12 billion dollars and 130,000 direct and indirect jobs to Canada’s economy.

Our head office is located in up and coming Railtown. Close to transit and just minutes away from Gastown and Chinatown. Free parking is available in our designated lot to those who drive. Our office features beautiful exposed brick and modern workstations in an open environment.

BC Maritime Employers Association is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Title: Senior Data and Business Analyst
Description:
Location: Richmond, BC, Canada

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Senior Data and Business Analyst to lead data-driven initiatives and drive strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate will leverage their expertise in data analytics, business processes, and visualization tools to uncover insights, solve complex business challenges, and deliver impactful BI solutions. This position is hybrid, working onsite 3 days per week from Tuesdays through Thursdays.

Responsibilities



Advanced Data Analysis and Visualization:
Extract, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to identify trends and deliver actionable insights.
Maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Qlik, and other analytics platforms.
Present data visualizations that effectively communicate key insights and trends to stakeholders.
Collaborate with leadership to understand strategic objectives and align data analytics initiatives accordingly.
Business Analysis and Strategy:
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Analyze business processes and recommend improvements to optimize operational performance.
Identify deficiencies in business/data processes, data quality, usability or accuracy.
Perform impact analysis and “what if” assessments for systems enhancements.
Document all systems-related processes and flows.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data solutions.
Project Management:
Utilize Jira/Aha to manage tasks, track project progress, and prioritize deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of data projects.
Lead data-focused workshops, meetings, and presentations to drive alignment across teams.
Data Governance and Quality Assurance:
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across systems.
Develop and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
Designing processes and proactively addressing data quality issues and improving reporting reliability.
Coordinates and conducts User Acceptance Testing.
Continuous Improvement and Innovation:
Stay at the forefront of industry trends, technologies, and advancements in data analytics.
Propose and implement innovative solutions, methodologies, and tools to enhance the organization's data capabilities.


Minimum Qualifications



Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data and business analysis.
Expertise in Power BI and Qlik for data visualization and reporting.
Extensive expertise in Excel and other data analysis tools for processing and analyzing large datasets.
Familiarity with JIRA and AHA for workflow and project management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (e.g., Salesforce, AWS and SAP).
Knowledge of Agile or Scrum methodologies.


Career Growth Philosophy

At Semtech, we seek innovation and leadership from each and every member of our team. Our goal is to ensure that our talented professionals are equipped with support, resources, and the opportunity to excel. Our pay-for-performance philosophy provides recognition and prestige coupled with a competitive compensation package.

The intent of this job description is to describe the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. Incumbents may be required to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically included in this description.

All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

A reasonable estimate of the pay range for this position is CAD $75,000 - $95,000. There are several factors taken into consideration in determining base salary, including but not limited to: job-related qualifications, skills, education and experience, as well as job location and the value of other elements of an employee’s total compensation package.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job description:

We seek a skilled and experienced data engineer to build data pipelines for data-driven plastic recycling. A successful candidate will join our dynamic team to design and develop pipelines for data gathering and analytics in recycling. An ideal candidate will have a strong data engineering/infrastructure knowledge, experience in machine learning and a software background. Chemical and process engineering knowledge, familiarity with IOTs, transformer-based architectures are a plus.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and processing using Python and SQL on local terminals and AWS. Enforce data hygiene to ensure accuracy.
Improve upon existing analytical data processing pipelines and machine learning algorithms.
Fine-tune and deploy transformer-based architectures to make process recommendations.
Collaborate across teams to develop and integrate data solutions into recycling lines. Report and present the state of the data pipelines and gathering capabilities.
Develop data acquisition pipelines for edge devices (e.g., sensors.) Ensure communication between edge devices and central systems using well-established protocols.
Develop and debug software for Windows platforms using C++, C#, or scripting languages




Candidate Requirements:

2+ years of experience in data engineering, software engineering, or machine learning.
Experience in Python, SQL, PyTorch, Windows Programming, and edge-device SDKs.
Understanding of cloud computing platforms and machine-learning development.
Track record of building and shipping high-quality work and achieving high reliability.
Experience with prototyping for a local real-time application.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and critical thinking.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Background in chemical engineering and materials processing is a plus

Title: Corporate Sustainability Reporting Analyst
Description:
Aviso Wealth:

At Aviso, we are dedicated to improving the financial well-being of Canadians. As a leading wealth management organization, we are committed to leadership, innovation, partnership, responsibility, and community. Working with talented and energetic professionals who exemplify our values every day, you will quickly notice that our people and dynamic ‘oneaviso' culture sets us apart. If you are looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, find out more about what Aviso has to offer at www.aviso.ca.

The Opportunity:

We're looking for an Analyst, Sustainability Reporting, to join our Corporate Sustainability team.

Reporting to the Director, Corporate Sustainability, the Analyst, Sustainability Reporting will play a crucial role in managing sustainability data and overseeing projects that drive our corporate sustainability initiatives. This position requires a blend of expertise in data analysis and sustainability practices, and project management to ensure the effective implementation of our sustainability reporting framework.

Who you are:


Service - You consider both internal and external stakeholders and demonstrate intent of understanding and putting the clients' needs first. You advocate service excellence and work to deliver solutions that meet the needs. You proactively develop strategic partnerships that allow Aviso Wealth to become a trusted advisor and partner
Execution - You are committed to achieving your goals and to succeed. This includes focusing on "getting things done", as well as recognizing and taking advantage of opportunities as they arise. You are consistently looking for ways to improve your personal best and see value in continuous improvement. You take accountability for your actions and learn from mistakes
Collaboration - You work collaboratively with others with the common goal of driving positive results. Making meaningful contributions to your team to achieve organizational goals is a priority. You proactively encourage collaboration, build trust and inclusion, and work to establish effective relationships both inside and outside of the organization



What your day looks like:

This is a hands-on implementation role focused on ensuring:


Organizational data related to our Corporate Sustainability program is accurate and aggregated into the Diligent ESG platform
The quality and integrity of our Corporate Sustainability dashboard
Project timelines are met


Key responsibilities:


Data Management and Analysis - utilizing the Diligent platform, collect, analyze, and interpret sustainability-related data to assess the impact and progress of various projects
Project Management - provide project management support for sustainability initiatives from conception through execution, ensuring alignment with our corporate sustainability strategy
Reporting and Documentation - support with the development of sustainability reporting internally and externally, ensuring accuracy and clarity in all documentation
Stakeholder Engagement - collaborate with cross-functional teams to track sustainability metrics across business operations
Continuous Improvement - monitor emerging trends and developments in global sustainability standards



Requirements

Your experience and skills:


Degree in Sustainability, or Business, Finance with a sustainability focus
Minimum of two years' professional experience in a sustainability-focused role at a reputable organization with a particular focus on data analysis- experience in a wealth management or financial services organization a plus
An understanding of the ESG and sustainable finance landscape
Ability to effectively communicate sustainability needs and concepts
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Fluent communication skills in English are required and bilingual skills in French are an asset
Exceptional project management skills
Strong data management skills and specific ability to interpret ESG data
Technical understanding of environmental/climate target setting and measurement
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment
High degree of professionalism
Project management certification is an asset



Benefits

Why Aviso Wealth?

At Aviso Wealth, you will find a dynamic and inclusive culture that rewards innovation and celebrates success.

Here are a few things that set us apart:


Competitive compensation package that rewards and recognizes individual contributions
Excellent health, dental and insurance benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees
Generous vacation time, fitness benefit, parental leave top-up options
Matching contributions to our retirement program
Commitment to the continuous improvement of our staff through learning & development and an education assistance program
Regular social events to foster teamwork



Equal Employment Opportunity

Aviso Wealth welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including persons with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

No recruiters or agencies, please.

Company Overview:

Aviso is a leading wealth management and investment services provider for the Canadian financial industry, with over $130 billion in total assets under administration and management, and over 1,000 employees. We're building a comprehensive, technology-enabled, client-centric wealth services ecosystem. Our clients include our partners, advisors, and investors. We're a trusted partner for nearly all credit unions across Canada, in addition to a wide range of portfolio managers, investment dealers, insurance and trust companies, and introducing brokers. Our partners depend on Aviso for specific solutions that give them a competitive edge in a rapidly evolving, highly competitive industry. Our investment dealer and mutual fund dealer and our insurance services support thousands of investment advisors. Our asset manager, NEI Investments, specializes in investing responsibly. Our online brokerage, Qtrade Direct Investing®, empowers self-directed investors, and our fully automated investing service, Qtrade Guided Portfolios®, serves investors who prefer a hands-off approach. Aviso Correspondent Partners provides custodial and carrying broker services to a wide range of firms. We have offices in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, and Winnipeg. Aviso is backed by the collective strength of our owners: the credit union Centrals, Co-operators/CUMIS, and Desjardins. We're proud to power businesses that empower investors.

A career with Aviso means being part of a group of talented, energetic professionals who live their values every day, and belonging to an organization dedicated to your success and career development. If you're looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, apply to join our team.

Salary

This position is posted with an expected salary range of $70,000 - $82,000 CAD annually. Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate and the requirements of the position.
